listings.name: Law Offices of Julie Rendelman, LLC

reviews.text: My minor stepson got in a little trouble last year, and we needed a lawyer fast. From a bench in the lobby of the police precinct I went on Avvo to look for the best defense lawyer, and Julie's name came up. I called the number (this was maybe 7 am) and got a text and call back from Katie Fernandez in less than 5 minutes. We explained what was going on, and she immediately called the precinct to let them know she was representing my stepson and to get more info on his arrest from them. Later that day she was able to get him released to us, and worked to build his defense case. She argued to get the case moved to family court, and ultimately all charges were dropped and his records sealed after a 3 month period with the only condition being that he didn't get into any more trouble. Julie and Katie were fully invested in the best possible outcome for my stepson, even checking in a few times afterwards to see how he was doing. We're so, so happy with the work they did, and can't recommend them enough.
reviews.author: Dan H

reviews.text: Julie was absolutely there for me and put me at ease as she guided me through the criminal process. She is compassionate, reliable and non-judgemental. My case was successfully dismissed and she even helped expedite a court-record sealing request. I would recommend Julie to anyone in need of a caring attorney who really will do the best for her clients.

listings.name: Saland Law PC

reviews.text:
I cannot begin to explain how frightened and scared I was when my husband called me to tell me he had been detained by the police at JFK airport. Not realizing the law in New York and accidentally having taken his firearm with him from Florida on a boat he sailed to NYC for training, TSA stopped him when he put his bag through screening to fly home. He had no intention of hiding anything or breaking the law but the port authority police handcuffed him and took him into custody for what was an honest mistake. Fast forward, my family found Jeremy. He was calm and reassuring during one of the most difficult times in our lives. He explained what he thought would happen and how he would get past the felony charge without serving jail time. He even was able to maintain my husband's clean record, clean! Jeremy never promised a result but he did promise he would work hard.  Though he was busy at times he answered all of our questions (sometimes we would tag team with questions) and calmed our nerves. Most importantly, in the end Jeremy delivered just like he said he would.

The lesson that is most important is don't forget to take any weapons out of your bag when travelling through the airport (especially in New York!) The penalties are real!!! The second lesson is if you do, consider Jeremy. My family and I are glad that we did!

listings.name: Hurwitz Law Group, Los Angeles Criminal Defense Attorney

reviews.text:
I reached out to several lawyers prior to obtaining Brian Hurwitz as my lawyer. It was clear from our first phone conversation that he was the guy for the job. My case initially started with a restraining order. It then went to three felonies (two being violent felonies) and a restraining order. I literally saw my life drastically changing for the worst right before my eyes. Brian had the courage to pick up both of my cases. The victim, who was my ex girlfriend, was doing everything in her power to make my life miserable and put me in jail for a long time. While Brian did not promise an end result, he promised that he would fight hard for the best outcome for me. There were many plot twists and turns throughout my case and during the restraining order process. Brian was able to weave through all of them and use his knowledge to get us out unscathed. It was obvious that Brian had many years of experience in the courtroom. He appeared to be well known, which is always a plus. He always came in professionally suited as well as his team. Brian saved my job and my future! After almost two long years, I am extremely happy to announce that I only have one NON VIOLENT misdemeanor and NO felonies! I am able to have my misdemeanor expunged in one year. I was never put on probation during or after the process. If you are reading my review, I HIGHLY recommend that you STOP looking elsewhere and hire this savvy man! He gave me hope in one of the darkest times of my life. I cannot brag on him enough! Thank you, Brian for all that you did for me. I appreciate you immensely and have a high level of respect for you!

Hire him NOW!

Best regards,
Shemiah
reviews.author: Fresh Parker

reviews.text: Today brian Hurwitz got me and my family off a 3 year probation felony assault case and got us an early termination from the case! Not only that but because we complied with all the courts orders of completing community service, paying a restitution and all court fees we also got it expunged from our records. Brian hurwitz is the only attorney I’ll ever need and want. If you are looking for an attorney that knows the laws and your rights then the Hurwitz Law Group is the only option for you!

Attorney Trinidad made sure I was going to get a second chance at life, & to be able to accomplish every single goal & dream I hoped for -- from my career to my family to being able to travel to even being able to be a part of my church entirely all-in. Ms. Cecilia Rodriguez, also a part of The Law Offices of Jed Silverman, was very informant, very communicative, & very prompt -- updating me with my case & what I needed to do on my part. She is so kind & patient & works really hard. They were always available if I had any questions or even any worry about the case & even my future. They are very professional, eloquent and very understandable. I mean, they were really patient with me in regards to my case, fees, life situations, all of it. When they come into court, they are well-respected. They represent their clients AND themselves very well. Attorney Trinidad represented me very well. Honestly, they all treated me as if I was their daughter, & for that, I'm eternally grateful. My case is dismissed, & I am planning to expunge this case in a few years when the time comes, & best believe I'm gonna have Attorney Jed & Attorney Trinidad represent me. Thank you for giving me a second chance at life. Thank you for reminding me there's so much more to live for. Thank you for fighting for me, so I'm able to finish school & continue to build my future & be an inspiration for others. I'm eternally grateful!

reviews.text:
I cannot recommend Mark Deniz highly enough! He and his team were incredibly professional, knowledgeable, and dedicated throughout my case. From the very beginning, Mark took the time to thoroughly understand my situation and provided clear, concise guidance at every step. I was definitely a difficult client at times in terms of being very overwhelmed and emotional in some parts, but Mark and his team were very assuring that they were working behind the scenes and it showed in the end.

On October 22nd, I was charged with a felony hit-and-run and arrested—my future and everything I had worked for felt like it was at stake. Mark was not only exceptional at communicating but also went to bat for me while expertly balancing the needs of his other clients. Fast forward to today, we achieved the best possible outcome: no jail time, no fines, dropped to a misdemeanor with a possible expungement as early as December next year, and only summary probation.

Mark is not only a phenomenal attorney but also an even better human being who genuinely cares about his community and the good people of San Diego County. His dedication, compassion, and professionalism set him apart. I can now be at peace in knowing our investment payed off. What a great late birthday gift and graduation present this was, Mark, my family and I are so grateful for you. I will always recommend Mark and his team to anyone in need because their services, communication, and overall approach are truly second to none! God is good.. all the time. Thank you Mark and everyone who is apart of this wonderful firm.
Christian

reviews.text: Mark took great care of me. He initially lowered my charge to a wet reckless and then later had it expunged from my record. 10/10 would recommend to anyone.

reviews.text:
When I first found mark it was from all the 5 star reviews and at first I thought it was too good to be true. I was facing a DUI case back in 2019 and I wasn’t sure what to do. He assured me that I only put down a small payment and if the case goes to court I will pay the rest of his fees which were already affordable in comparison. To make a long story short my case ended up with a complete Acquittal and I don’t believe he even charged me his original fee of 600$. I was in disbelief of the good news and from there on out I knew he would be the only defense attorney I would use. This review is for my felony I received back in 2012. I had completed 3 years of probation as well as time served and community service (I took a plea bargain) for felony evading. When court finally came around back in 2021 Mark went up to bat for me as the prosecutor did not want to expunge my case. To make a long story short he got not only my felony reduced to a misdemeanor but also my record wiped clean!!! This man is a man of the people and anyone would be lucky to have them In their corner. Hands down best defense layer in the city of San Diego !!!! Thank you again Mark, sorry for late review …
Best of luck
- Nick
reviews.author: ncjerkin

reviews.text: Peter Blair is not only very knowledgeable about the law and  criminal justice system but he also really cares for this clients and will do whatever he can to help them. He is honest and helps you sometimes look at things in a different perspective, which is not always something you may want to hear but it helps you get the big picture if need be. Peter helped my sons father go from getting 10 years minimum prison time down to barley 2 years. Not only was he there for us while my husband at the time was dealing with court, but he was also there for us while he served time all across the country. Literally, in 5 different states. Peter was there for us every step of the way which gave us sense of security, knowledge, understanding and peace. I was pregnant with our son at the time so this was extremely important and helpful. I don’t know how many times I contacted Peter and he answered all the questions I had without me feeling like an inconvenience. Not only is Peter one of the best lawyers in San Diego but he’s also a family man so he truly understands how important family is and keeping them together, which i believe is one of the qualities that makes him the great lawyer that he is. Peter also has great resources, unfortunately during my husbands first case his work wrongfully terminated him. Peter pointed us in the right direction and got us in contact with a lawyer that won our case. To top it off, Never did I think that I’d need a lawyer for myself but when I did, Peter was there for me too. He got my felony completely dropped which saved my clean record. Another quality I really liked about Peter is that he gets back to you no matter what time you contact him. Weekends, Holidays and after office hours, there’s no such thing as 9-5 because whenever you need him, he is there. Peter also owns up to misunderstandings, even if they’re your fault. I misunderstood that for my B&R I needed to bring my court paperwork. Since I showed up without it I couldn’t do the B&R which meant I was a “no show“ and could get jail time, but Peter didn’t let that happen. He told the judge it was his fault, misunderstanding that I “missed” the B&R and because of this the judge gave me two more months to have it completed. I could go on and on about our 3+ years experience with Peter, how great it was and how thankful we are but know this. Picking Peter to handle your case(s) and represent you, a family member or a friend, is something you will not regret, but be thankful for. He is truly a blessing. Thank you Peter for everything you have done, not only for myself but for my family too.
reviews.author: Serena Kalani

reviews.text:
If you are reading this, you have found the right attorney! I was in the most distressed time of my life. I did not know where to start. My brother hired one of the best criminal attorneys in Memphis,TN. I called him and explained my situation and I asked if he knew or had colleagues in San Diego,CA. He said, no but I would advise you go on the Avvo website to start. Also, he said; you do not want a lawyer that has been doing this too long or right out of law school. I thanked him and he said good luck! I then, went to the Avvo website and after scrolling through. I read Peter Blaire’s background, yrs of experience, and the statement “  Our primary goal is to fight aggressively on your behalf to ensure you move beyond your case towards a successful future and a clean record” grabbed my attention. I knew the uphill battle I was facing.  I called Peter Blaire immediately and gave a summary of my situation.  Peter Blaire spoke with confidence, directness, and assertiveness. No sugar coating. I knew I found the right man for the job and he is not what I call “ a glory getter”! I expressed to Mr. Blaire from the beginning; I have integrity and will be transparent with my situation.  After almost 1.5yrs with patience and resilience my false allegations of a misdemeanor and felony charges were dismissed! I took 2 DV classes and parenting. These classes are effective for victims and offenders. I also had to have someone monitor me with my son for 6 months on the family side to prove the truth! I could breathe again.  Peter Blaire’s commitment and demeanor helped remind myself I was fighting for myself and 4yr old son. It fueled my determination and motivation to prove the truth of false allegations. Furthermore, I had to hire a family attorney. Despite what I have endured and continue in this process. Always trust your gut! A long story short. I was young and naive when I married a charismatic high ranking naval man who who claimed to be a victim and portrayed me as the offender.  I was trapped in a situation across the US away from my family. My case was not clear cut and was unique.  I hope this review helps someone in a similar situation. Peter Blaire is your wingman, his job is to defend and protect by having your back! Don’t give up!

David Goggins once said; “Living a life avoiding failure does only one thing for you: it never gives you the opportunity to see what you truly are capable of”.
reviews.author: Alexandra Pochop

reviews.text: I hired Peter Blair to defend me in a serious case recently. His rates were the best out of the attorneys I considered hiring. He came to the county jail the day I contacted him and talked to me about my options. He even tried to give me some cash so I could bail out and have money for a bus home. The guard wouldn't allow it though.  Peter helped me get my charges reduced, get a good plea deal, and continues to help me with advice and action throughout my probation process. He's also going to go to court on my behalf in a year in order to expunge my record and have me taken off of probation. Peter is a great lawyer and I would recommend him to anyone facing charges and needing help.

reviews.text:
Mr Isenberg lied to me 5 years ago and it will affect me for the rest of my life. When I hired him he told me he would dismiss both of my cases so we could expunge them in the future. But he lied. He had a rookie attorney represent me in court years ago and now only one of my cases can be expunged while the other case can still be seen by certain entities.

Additionally: Randall Isenberg said he would expunge and seal both of my cases for $1200. The lady Gloria called me yesterday (05/12/2022) and told me they would still honor $1200 for both cases. I walked in today to sign and the lady tells me they would charge me $1500. This felt like they spit in my face twice.

This firm has no word. I would STRONGLY advise to go with a better attorney.

reviews.text:
Outstanding Legal Representation by Nafiz Ahmed

I recently sought the assistance of a lawyer to apply for expungement and was fortunate enough to find Nafiz Ahmed. From our first consultation, I knew I was in capable hands. Despite the fact that I still had two weeks left to complete my probation, Nafiz's exceptional legal expertise and dedication to my case resulted in an outstanding outcome. He successfully achieved the early termination of my probation, allowing me to proceed with my expungement application without delay.

Nafiz's professionalism, knowledge, and unwavering commitment to my case were evident throughout the process. He meticulously prepared and presented my motion, addressing every detail with precision. His strategic approach and persuasive arguments were instrumental in the judge granting my motion.

I am extremely grateful for Nafiz Ahmed's hard work and highly recommend him to anyone in need of a skilled and dedicated lawyer. His efforts have made a significant positive impact on my life, and I cannot thank him enough for the excellent outcome he achieved for me. If you are looking for a lawyer who will go above and beyond for your case, look no further than Nafiz Ahmet.

reviews.text: I was searching the web back in early March for an attorney in San Jose, CA. When I came across attorney Holden Green! I decided to call. I was surprised that he answered! You see I live in Texas now and needed him to handle an old arrest on my record from 1985 in San Jose. He listen to everything I wanted him to do with the old arrest on my record. Advised me on what I needed to do via email to him with payment and documents! He wasted no time! I'm very impressed with his professionalism and knowledge of the law! I will report that today I got the call from him stating the old arrest on my record has been expunged! Attorney Green got this done in less than 2 months! Wow! That's impressive! If you're looking for an attorney that gets things done this is your man! Hire him you won't be disappointed!

reviews.text: Feels good to have my record cleared. Mr. Green is the guy to get that done. Fast, professional and efficient communication by Mr. Green made the whole experience easy.
reviews.author: Steve Quento

reviews.text:
VERY POSITIVE EXPERIENCE DEALING WITH HOLDEN GREEN.
I earned myself a felony when I was 19 years old, (55 years ago) ( 459 auto burglary). It caused me issues with employment and later when I started my business, on who I could get work from, and needless to say it was embarrassing.
i did quite a bit of research on what needed to be done, and then I contacted a half a dozen attorneys in Santa Clara county.  Right off the get-go several of the attorneys had no idea how to deal with this, so I randomly selected Holden, based on other positive reviews, to meet with first. That was in October 2020. We met in an outside cafe in down town San Jose ‘because of Covid’. He was VERY straight up about everything, he explained everything in detail, and all the steps, including the restoration of my 2nd amendment . rights, which is a separate step. He also made it very clear that the courts were a mess because of Covid, and I should be prepared for this going into Spring before I would get a court date. This is the only thing that Holden did not get correct; Holden called me on January 20th and told me that my felony was reduced to a misdemeanor and the misdemeanor has been expunged.  So spring came on January 20th 2021
I found Holden to be very professional, and very thorough.   He returned my emails instantly as well as my phone calls. This has been a very rewording experience.  I am now 74 years old and this has been hanging over me for most of my life.  I just regret that I did not do this many years ago.
reviews.author: malcolm perkins

reviews.text: Holden Green was a phenomenal attorney! Not only did he help get my conviction reduced, he also got it expunged and it allowed me to have a new beginning. Now I can begin my career and apply for jobs/ housing/etc. without hesitating and having fear of rejection. His customer service, responsiveness, and efficiency was on point. As soon as you request his services he gets right on it and gets it done! He truly doesn't mess around, highly recommended!

reviews.text: well it was 2 months ago I contacted mr green regarding a felony I had I wanted to restore my dignity. I committed a crime when I was 18 and paid the price for the last 15 years. I had a felony for GTA and it was a pain in the butt to get jobs and do other things without this over my head. I finally am a felony free man. he told me the time frame would take about 2-3 months and I was ok with that. mr green stood in communication every time I contacted him. never ignored my text or calls. he was able to get my felony reduced to a misdemeanor and then expunged from my record. it was very relieving to know I didn't even have to go to court. I live in Tracy. and the case was in Santa Clara county and I did this all by phone. worth the price. thanks mr green
reviews.author: michael ortega

reviews.text:
There are no words I could possibly use to thank Mr.Green enough for his service. It all started when SJPD violated rights and lied about my charges. Long story short, I ended up with 3 felonies; Sales of Marijuana, transportation of marijuana, and Sales of Narcotics. I'm not a criminal nor a drug dealer, but SJPD made me out be a big time kingpin. At first, I didn't think I needed a lawyer, me being stubborn as I am, I thought everything would be dropped. Something inside me told me reach out to a lawyer and I consulted with 2-4 lawyers before hiring Mr.Green to help me out. All the other lawyers didn't want to hear much about my case uphand before a retainer was placed. I was searching on avvo one night and decided to give Mr.Green a call at 10PM... the night before Memorial Day, suprisingly enough, he answered! He said "I forgot to turn my answering machine on and I never pick up calls this later... but Hi, I'm Holden Green and what can I help you with?" At this point I was incredibly apologetic, however he insured me it was okay and he was ready to hear my story and give me his advice. After talking on the phone worh him for about 45 minutes, (mind you its about 10:45pm) he set up an appointment to meet with me on Memorial Day! The one day everyone else was off... Mr.Green was willing to talk to me. He was willing to work with my budget and was never ever rushing my payments with him. He even asked me if all the cash I handed him was everything I had, he was willing to give me some money back if I was dead broke!!! Who do you know that would do that? Mr.Green has a heart for his clinets and he cares. He knows what's he doing he moves so confidently in the court room. Each and everytime we went to court, Mr.Green knew almost everyone in the room and had small talk with everyone. He lifts up the spirit of the courtroom when he walks in. As a young person facing 3 felonies, he fought for my life. My life would be over if I was a convicted felon, but with the magic of Mr.Green.... he went beyond the call of duty to insure my freedom. He made sure I did everything I had to do to make it look good in the eyes lf the District Attorney and judge. After nearly a year of fighting for life, I ended up with 2 misdemeanors and one felony that's only on my record for a year. I will be calling Mr,Green next year for my expungment! From facing prison time to only 90 days of weekend work cut in half to 45 days? You really can't complain. Mr.Green is nothing but the best out there. Hopefully I never everytime have to use his services again, but I've recommended him to many of my peers. Mr.Green is the people's lawyer and he's not a greedy person. He's very nice and has always answered every single question I've had in a timely manner. If you're looking for lawyer, LOOK NO MORE. I promise you, this will be the best decision you've ever made in your life. You can never put a price on freedom and I'll forever be greatful for Mr.Green.

Thanks for everything Mr.Green!

reviews.author: Marc Owens

listings.address: 608 W 12th St Ste B, Austin, TX 78701

reviews.text:
Chris Perri is - in my opinion - the most talented habeas attorney in Texas.  While I recommend you hire Chris before your family or friend needs a habeas attorney - Chris Perri is who to go to if that person had an incompetent trial attorney or if new evidence has come to light.  For me as a Republican to think so highly of a former Democratic congressional candidate should say something.  Competence trumps politics.

It goes beyond saying looking for a habeas attorney is not the same as getting a traffic ticket attorney.  I recommend any family member or friend to review Mr. Perri’s briefs in the Texas appellate courts.

Win loss records are tough to glean in Texas since almost all won cases are expunged.  However, there is one really cool statistic that is true as of the date of my review.

For writs of habeas corpus (do a partial search of WR and then Perri at the CCA website), Chris has 6 pending cases out of a total of 18.  Most of the other habeas attorneys with notable Google presences as in the range of 1 or 2 pending cases out of like 50 total cases.

Find me an attorney in Texas with a better publicly available writ percentage.  I don’t think you can.  Furthermore, that percentage cannot include the won cases because of expungement law.

Furthermore, I urge you to go in and look at even the cases Chris has lost.  We’re talking writs of habeas corpus here - not getting a lawyer to sign you up for defensive driving.  Every single case that is challenged by local officials has an objection.  Furthermore, almost every single case has gotten at least an independent review by the CCA.  This does not happen with most lawyers much less those who go pro se.

Chris has a vetting process which is easier on the budget and fair.  Finances aside, this protects your loved one from having a poorly written writ actually filed and you then have no more realistic bites at the apple for your family member or friend.

I have paid Chris for a charitable writ of habeas corpus case that is still pending (it is for the 1 client of Chris Perri’s that is not in TDC) at a discounted rate.

(In the anticipation of potential ultimate victory and expungement, I am not posting the case name in this review.  However, even if the final outcome is adverse, I know Chris put up the best fight of any attorney and I know his client has and will have all of Mr. Perri’s briefs to deal with any potential future background issues while the case is pending or if God forbid there is an adverse outcome in a system designed not to allow writs to be considered easily.)
reviews.author: Hershel Patel

reviews.text: Where my last lawyer failed, Chris prevailed. Battled getting my record expunged for over 5 years with a budget attorney before giving up. Should have called Chris from day one. reviews.text: Mrs. Tori is the best attorney in Jacksonville Fl! Whatever the charge please hire her. She is professional, knowledgeable, and makes the process so smooth. I was facing 2 criminal charges in which one a felony and she was able to get both charges dropped. I was facing jail time/ probation. I thank God I had Mrs. Tori as my attorney! I did not have to appear for any court cases. I was able to work and be a mom to my two young boys while my attorney handled all the court cases. She kept me updated on everything and made the very challenging experience very pleasant. She of course did not make any promises for the outcome of my case, but the outcome was in my favor. If you are looking for a attorney who will fight for you, please hire Mrs. Tori! She was worth every dollar! Thanks to her I could continue with my life with a clean record. reviews.text: My wife and I have over 35 years of combined experience in the criminal justice field.  However, we were completely unprepared when our young adult son was recently arrested for Boating Under the Influence.  Without hesitation I immediately placed a call to Epstein & Robbins.  I am well aware of the excellent reputation that David Robbins has in handling alcohol related offenses.  He personally returned my phone call within minutes.  Mr. Robbins was able to not only provide me the information I needed, but more importantly, he was able to give assurances to my wife that our son would be alright.  We hired him immediately and Mr. Robbins was able to quickly secure our son's release on bail.  Throughout the process he and his firm kept my wife and I updated on the legal process and was soon able to get the case completely dropped!  He is now working on getting our son's record expunged.  I cannot say enough positive things about this law firm and Mr. Robbins in particular. listings.name: Musca Law

reviews.text: Musca Law is an outstanding Criminal Defense team, and I do mean team. I was charged with a first degree felony for obstruction of Justice by port authorities who suspected me of being an arms dealer because they found in my trunk a rebuild kit for a lower unit to a 300 Blackout assault rifle. The reason I was even approached by these officers is I was taking pictures of a ship that was under investigation for transporting illegal arms overseas. I was unaware that you could not take pictures of any vessels while in the port and did not have any knowledge of this vessel being under port surveillance, but this did not matter to the arresting officers. I tried to explain to them that I was just a tourist, and was just trying to get some pictures of these huge cargo ships and Navel ships to share with friends and offered to delete any pictures that I had already taken but to no avail, these officers were convinced that I was involved with arms dealing. Even after I explained that I am a decorated vet and just visiting the port for the first time they insisted that I was lying to them. I spent two days in a holding cell before I was charged and told what bond I could pay for my release. As soon as I returned home I began to look for an attorney but I could not find a local attorney that could help me with such a case, especially one of this magnitude. So I had to look for law firm that was large enough to handle the case for me but still only cost me a fair price since I did not live anywhere near Port. After explaining my predicament to several law firms and getting projections of the cost for my defense I chose Musca Law. They were the only Law Firm that said that they could insure that I would not be charged for a Felony that would destroy my rights especially my rights to bare arms. Knowing that I lived out of town they even insured that I would not have to be present for the several court sessions that proceeded that actual trial date. Prior to that they first got my charges reduced to a Misdemeanor charge which I was very satisfied with but the Lawyers at Musca law were not satisfied with that because I would still have something on my record, when I went to court on November 20 2019, I expected to be charged with a Misdemeanor of Trespass but to my astonishment I walked out of the court room with no charges on my record at all. For a vet who prides the right to bare arms an having a clean record is a must if you want to own a weapon. Musca Law is one hell of a law firm and like I said I had an entire team of Lawyers working my case when I hired Musca Law and they made sure that my rights were protected so if your like me and find yourself in serious trouble just being in the wrong place at the wrong time and want a great Law firm for a very reasonable price Call Musca Law, they really listen to you and will fight for all your rights.

listings.name: The Law Office of Stefanie Dorn

reviews.text:
I always wanted to work in a career of public service, however the system led me to believe a small mistake in my youth would label me a criminal for the rest of my life. After thirteen years of being haunted by a record that didn’t reflect who I have become, I found Stefanie’s videos on YouTube. The things she said resonated with me. She explained how passionately she believes people like me should be able to move on with our lives, not shackled to the mistakes we made in our past. She inspired me to believe I was no longer a lost cause.

Getting your record vacated sounds like a pipe dream to someone who had surrendered to a reality where my future was dictated by a lapse of judgement in my early 20’s. Even if it was an option, I assumed expungement was something only available to folks wealthier and with better connections than I have. Let me say, I wish I had someone like Stefanie on my side a decade ago because she is hands down the best. It is obvious that she believes in the work she does and sees the best in people.

Stefanie took my call the very first time I reached out and reviewed my case free of charge on the spot. She gave me a play by play of every element of my record as it pertained to the criteria for having it vacated. She assured me of her experience and I left the conversation trusting her confidence in her work. Not only that, retaining her council was unbelievably affordable, even to me as a student working a part-time job. I knew Stefanie wasn’t going to give me false hope for a paycheck like many lawyers might.

Stefanie made the process effortless for me. When she needed information, she provided easy instructions and online forms that saved me the hassle of navigating legal jargon and paperwork. Not only was my record vacated in a few short months, but the judge and prosecution sang our praises in court for the work we did. She is a joy to work with and the only person I would trust to my friends or family in Washington State looking to move on from a legal past that feels daunting and unforgiving.

Thank you so much to Stefanie and her dream team. Now I can focus on a life, family, and career I always wanted but never thought possible. 🥲

reviews.text: Stefanie Dorn is helping me to expunge my record in a professional and dependable manner. I am honor to be her client! As time goes by I will continue to work with her in any possible situation and will referral her to all my peeps… THANK  YOU!!! Stefanie Dorn!

reviews.text:
Kter Malkut is my pen name. My name is Rozain C. Chitty.

Extremely dishonest law firm. I am a Maryland attorney who advised my nephew who had a dui issue in DC to hire scrofano law based on their reviews. I was also in contact with another attorney who said he would have to plead guilty and get on a program where he could have his record cleared. Her charge was $3500.

Chris Muttimer from Scrofano law told my nephew that he would not have to plead guilty and that they could get a non-prosecution and wanted $5000. My nephew was keen to go that route. AFTER the payment of $5000 there was a guilty plea and they did exactly what the other attorney had promised to do. In addition it was extremely difficult to get them to finish the submission of the paperwork after the program was over,

Mr Muttimer is no longer with the firm and I wrote to Mr. Scrofano explaining what happened and my concern because I advised my nephew to hire their firm. I asked him for a refund of $1500. He did not respond. I am hoping to file a complaint with the DC Bar regarding the unethical behavior on the part of the firm.
reviews.author: kter malkut

reviews.text: I couldn’t have asked for a more perfect trial . Although Attorney Ghnocci fell ill right before my trial date he was there in court ready to litigate my case . He discussed my possibility and gave me a brief overview of his points. It turns out we didn’t need them as the officer didn’t show and the case was thrown out . It was amazing and then Attorney Ghnocci actually gave me advice on how to get the charge expunged and offered to do it for me . The man’s amazing !

reviews.text:
UPDATE: In addition to handling my case, he also handled the expungement process for me and, even with the pandemic/court delays, he was able to get it sealed!!

Christopher is an awesome attorney and I would seek his legal counsel in the future (but hopefully I won't have to do so). When I received a court citation (speeding-related), I went through a process of interviewing different attorneys to determine which one I wanted representing me. When I held my initial conversation with Christopher and presented the facts to him, he was very confident (but approachable) and provided me with a high-level strategy for how he could get my case dismissed. He did this even before I made my decision to move forward with him and before I paid him money, which I appreciated. When I decided to move forward with him, he elaborated on that strategy. As a result of his expertise, sincerity, and thoroughness, I'm happy to say the judge dismissed my case! I also saw him represent another client; I saw that he consistently applies his legal expertise and strategic approach to attempt to ensure favorable outcomes for his client. I'd highly recommend him!
reviews.author: BDaS

reviews.text:
Mr. Mutimer was a great attorney and exceeded my expectations.  This was a second offense DUI and I was fully prepared to have to take a guilty plea.  After talking with Christopher he reassured me that if we requested a trial we could get a better deal than a suspended jail term.

Up until the day of my hearing I was unsure due to the fact that the state said they would enhance my changes if I requested a trial.  The morning of Christopher invited me to the office to watch my body cam footage with him so he could once again reassure me.  After this meeting I decided to put it all in Christopher’s hands and we requested a trial.

Two months before my trial, the prosecutors office decided to accept a deferred sentence and I entered the deferred sentencing process.  One year later my case was dismissed and I didn’t even have to return to DC or stand in front of a judge.

From the beginning it was obvious that Christopher was well known within the court house and as a result I felt so much more comfortable.  From having my hearing first on the docket to negotiating with the prosecutors with a simple in person conversation or email.

I highly recommend Christopher to everyone, especially those who wish to maintain a clean record.

reviews.text:
Hello My name is Pierre I had a 17 year old conviction that I was struggling, fighting,and trying my best to get off of my record. I was so sad, stressed-out, Frustrated, and angry for the first 15 years after the conviction that was given me a lot of lost opportunities, a stalled career in a working field of Law Enforcement. I had transformer my angry in to putting everything on paper about my pain and my case I had ended up putting my work into the form of an presentation after being turn it down by 4 attempts to get an attorney to help me get Through the next level with my work I ended up hiring   Hannah Akintoye, Esq. she was able to listen to my story about what happened and the pain and suffering and tough time I had since the conviction was coming up on my 17th year she understood that I really wanted to get my record cleared in some form so that I can have my life back and a be able to follow my dreams of being in a working field of Law with no Restrictions or or concerns about my past she was able to Successfully have my record on my Conviction Set-Aside I was so happy with her Work the whole entire day that she gave me the news did the judge signed off on the order to set aside my conviction. I will most definitely recommend her as an attorney to anybody that may need one !
PS Hannah Akintoye, Esq. she is the best Attorney that I have ever Hired!

reviews.text: When I initially contacted this attorney for a quote I knew I would seek his legal help. Other attorneys I had contacted about my legal need made it seem like there was a very small chance my expungement would happen and even tried convincing me that a small number of them are accepted. Micheal Risley and his team handled my questions and needs with true professionalism and integrity.

reviews.text: If you are wanting to get an expungement or a Pardon I highly recommend Michael Risley and his staff.  They take care of everything for you from start to finish! I was able to review my Pardon and Parole case voted on via Zoom call so that was super easy as well. I did watch Michael in action for the cases that required a personal appearance and You don’t want anyone but Michael speaking on your behalf to the Members of the Parole Board. He was simply amazing! Thank you so much for restoring my rights after me not having any rights for almost 20 years Michael. It was a great Christmas Present to get the call that the Governor signed it! If there was 6 stars I would click it.

reviews.text: Michael and Team did a amazing job of handling my expungement and pardon...they were always available if I had any questions and kept me well informed throughout the entire process...words cant express how thankful I am to Michael and his team on giving me a new chance at life....oh and also his prices was very reasonable and they will even work out payment plans with you.

reviews.text: If you’re finally ready to get your rights restored, please consider Michael Risley and his very knowledgeable staff of Lawyers such as Vincent and Ashlyn. I have a Governor’s Pardon as well as an expungement. Don’t delay another day get back the rights that were stripped away. It cost you nothing to talk with them  if they accept your case. I can attest that they will get your freedom restored, best money I ever spent !

reviews.text: Michael Risley's office is the real deal. Worth every penny. Don't second guess whether the price is too much to pay compared to other firms. There were no issues and clear communication about what to expect, and the chances of success were concise. reviews.text: At the age of 73, I found myself in need of a great criminal defense attorney. This need was not for myself, I desperately needed someone to represent my 45 year old son who has lost his way because of drug addiction.  He was facing two felony charges, both of which were very,  serious, with a maximum of 20 years on one and a maximum of 5 years on the other plus thousands of dollars in fines. The only experience I had ever had with the courts was divorce court 43 years  ago. My son had only traffic offenses. Neither of us knew anything about the court system or where to begin, much less what to expect. I contacted Adam Banner's office after researching attorneys online and he called me back within a short period of time. I made an appointment for us to meet with him, we met with Adam and he explained in great detail what to expect and a list of things my son could do to help himself. I hired Adam to represent my son that day! My son made matters worse by being arrested 2 more times on misdemeanors. Instead of helping himself as Adam had suggested, he dug himself a deeper hole. Adam worked very hard to get my son the best outcome we could hope for. Because of Adam Banner, my son was just given an opportunity to turn his life around and come out of this with no felony conviction and no jail time, with a chance to have his record expunged. The rest is up to my son!  Adam Banner did everything humanly possible to help my son, he was always professional, available to answer any question we had, as well as lead us through every appearance and kept us updated as to what kind of deal he was  attempting to pursue. I will be forever grateful to Adam Banner and would highly recommend him to anyone who needs a criminal defense attorney. Adam is not only an  outstanding attorney, but also a very compassionate person. You can't go wrong with Adam Banner!
reviews.author: Linda Stewart

reviews.text:
First I would like to start out by saying, Adam and Nichole are absolutely amazing! I have gotten into some trouble when I first turned 18 and it pretty much put a damper on my future. It held me back from reaching my full potential where I had to change my college courses, drop out and it affected my potential jobs and career choices. I started to feel like there wasn't any hope and developed a lot of trauma from it and decided to not face it. Fast forward many, many years later, my fiance knew how much this has put a burden me.

I have talked about going back to school and seeking a certain profession. He surprised me by finding Adam and we instantly knew he was the guy for us. Mind you, we no longer live in Oklahoma and they made it such a breeze and kept me feeling comfortable and confident. Long story short guys, a couple days ago, it was finalized and my silly record was expunged and sealed! I cried when I received the great news and honestly looking forward to my future.

So thankful for Adam and his team! They truly saved my life. I definitely recommend them to anyone looking for an expungement or pardon!  I have a new lease on life!

My many thanks to Adam and Nichole and the rest of the team!
reviews.author: Tina Hall

reviews.text:
Quick Expungements
They very quickly helped seal records of an old criminal case that was hanging over my head and causing me problems. That case has now been expunged and I can continue pursuing my goals. Thank you Fassio Law for your help!
reviews.author: Kimberly Ellison

reviews.text: I hired Marcy Fassio to assist with a misdemeanor DUI. They immediately went to work and will work with you financially as well if you need them to unlike most places! This was the only fault I have ever had and yet the DA tried to give me 2 years probation along with community service with zero proof from them that I even did what they claimed! My case was brought down to only 1 yr probation, very minimal court fees and zero community service with a no contest plea. I wanted to plea not guilty, but I refuse to allow a jury to decide my future and face possible jail time over a misdemeanor, so this was the best choice for me. She went over every single option line by line, she made sure I was FULLY aware of what I was signing and agreeing to. Once my probation is done, all of this will be expunged from my name as if nothing ever happened to begin with! I, above and beyond, recommend Fassio Law to represent you! Every representative that works there has ALWAYS been supportive, professional and if who you're looking for isn't available, whoever answers the call will do what they can to take a minute to look at your case and answer your questions! They ALL make you feel like you are their priority and it absolutely shows! I will forever refer them to anyone in need!

They made me feel that my case was important & that I could trust them to do everything within their power to see that I received a pardon.  My case recently went before the Pardon & Parole Board, & I was granted a pardon.  I don't believe I would have been granted this pardon without being represented by Mr. Adler.  As soon as possible I will use the Adler Law Firm to seek expungement of my records.  I highly recommend Tommy Adler & staff for your legal needs

reviews.text: I contacted Philip's office about a simple possession charge out of Rutherford county. reviews.author: T Wyatt

reviews.text:
I highly recommend the PNC Law office.  Phillip was able to get my niece's 5  year-old TN violation dismissed and expunged for a very reasonable fee in a reasonable time.   Since I live in NC and located this firm through Google, it was blind luck that I found an attorney who did what he said he would do.  When I called his office initially, Tabitha was both knowledgeable and friendly but not pushy.  She suggested that I would want to talk with Phillip prior to signing a contract, which was exactly what I wanted.  Tabitha scheduled a telephone appointment where Phillip explained what he though he would be able to do and his expected time frame. My niece had received a driving without a license in TN following having her NC license revoked for DUI.  When she became eligible to get her NC license reinstated, the outstanding TN violation showed up and put the reinstatement of  her NC  license at a standstill.  The week after I signed the contract Nashville was hit with a devastating
tornado, including extensive damage to Phillip's office/building.  Shortly after the tornado, COVID-19 hit. Nonetheless, Tabitha kept me informed every step of the way and encouraged me to call if I had questions.  Tabitha telephoned today telling me mission accomplished!  I am so happy that I chose Phillip and would highly recommend him and would use him again.
I especially liked that I was not expected to sign a contract before talking to Phillip.  I  liked that there was open communication. I felt my business was not taken for granted.  Appreciation was expressed to me on several occasions.  Phillip is honest and his fee was reasonable.
reviews.author: Jean Deal

reviews.text: I was very scared about going to court but Mr. Clark reassured me that everything would be fine and it was. His prior job gave him so many connections on the inside that he pretty much knew all the judges and workers and told me how he thought things were gonna go, and they went exactly as he said. reviews.text: Okay I'm sorry this is going to be long but if you're reading reviews to find an attorney I hope you found this one I live in North Carolina and I got in trouble in Tennessee about 16 years ago and it was never resolved I went online and searched attorneys and pick mr. Nash just out of the blue. I truly wish I could pick lottery tickets as good as finding good attorney. I spoke with the paralegal and within an hour mr. Nash called me personally to discuss my case my case was old it was not in the clerk's office are in the computers so they had to dig for it the next day is paralegal called me and told me what was going on this was a Friday. The next week mr. Nash called me again personally to tell me my options he was going to try and expunged mycase so I didn't have to pay the fines and save me money. After further discussion he said that I wasn't a good candidate for expungement but told me after the time he had spent that I didn't need him or any attorney all I had to do was pay the fines at the clerk's office. I paid an attorney in my hometown $10,000 and spoke to him once mr. Nash spoke to me twice personally and his paralegal twice and then told me did I didn't need to pay him and told me how to take care of it myself so if you are looking for an attorney that will work for you and be honest with you do yourself a favor and hire mr. Nash. I sure you this is not a paid advertisements and completely honest I don't even live in the state

reviews.text: Mr. Pugh was the first attorney who didn't try to take advantage of me for profit. I felt from the time I met him for an in-person strategy meeting that he was attentive, caring, and knowledgeable. It was through his determination and precision striking that we got the outcome that was Just and Fair. He was even willing to roll up his sleeves and stick it to them, if necessary, but it was over before it got there. It was a relief to have him in my corner during a tumultuous and stressful time in my life. He treats you with respect, doesn't judge you, and always tries to understand you and where you're coming from no matter how messed up it may be. Working with Mr. Pugh resulted in the claim against me being dismissed and he even went as far as to tell me he would get it expunged for me. Peace of mind is worth everything and that's the type of representation you get here!

reviews.text: I was scared and worried I could not get my records expunged. I had over nine pages of arrests on my criminal record. Mann and Maria Brustien did their best with their knowledge to help me receive a positive outcome and expunge my record. They reassured me my criminal record might not be expunged within two years, but they would continue to work to exceed the positive outcome. reviews.text: I am late in the game on posting my review and I apologize to this wonderful franchise for this. I kept starting to write it and then got distracted and just never finished it. This last November I was visiting Las Vegas, and got myself into a pickle. I am from California and we were just visiting for two nights. Ended up getting in a heated fight with my boyfriend at our hotel, And ended up being me that was arrested because he had a scratch on his face, which was actually an old scratch from our new puppy. Needless to say, the cops did not believe him or I and I was led away in handcuffs. Spent the night in jail instead of celebrating my daughter’s 21st birthday. I was arrested for battery. I thought My life was over. I just started nursing school. I googled best lawyers in Las Vegas, and this firm came up. Best decision I ever made hands-down. I did not even have to show up in person for my court appearance Augustus showed up on my behalf. All charges were dropped.. I thought thought I would be fighting this for years.. They even let me make payments! Super fair price, and if I ever get myself in another pickle, I will definitely be reaching out to Augustus Claus! No offense to him, but I hope that I never have to speak with them again ha ha.. if you find yourself in trouble, do yourself a favor and don’t shop around. Immediately contact this company, and you will never regret it! The staff at the office was so friendly and best of all. They believed me when I explained what happened. I thought I would have to prove my case but one simple phone call changed my life forever. Thank you, Augustus and office staff! You are truly my heroes, and I will never forget what you’ve done for me. I will actually be using this firm to have my record sealed or expunged because they told me, even though the charges were dropped, if a company wants to look super hard into my background, they will be able to find that I was arrested, even though it was dismissed… And they said I could even make payments on that! I’ll end my paragraph here, but please do yourself a favor and contact this company if you are in trouble.

reviews.text: When I was fortunate enough to come across Neil Roy I was doing what many of you are probably doing... searching "criminal lawyers" in Google to read reviews in the hopes of finding one who might not only understand what you're going through but be ready and willing to help. His secretary was kind and gracious while taking my information and assured me Neil would be in touch after court. True to her word, Neil called me that same afternoon. He asked me a few questions over the phone and had my history and information pulled up within minutes. From there he took the wheel, giving me step by step instructions on how he was going to help me through this process. He was in constant communication with me throughout the entire process and honestly just took all of my anxiety and worry away. Today marks the end of our journey to have my record expunged and the beginning of the rest of my life. Truthfully I'm a tiny bit sad that it's over. Neil is a great attorney and human and you should consider yourself lucky to have found him on Google today.

reviews.text:
I was referred to Ahmad & Nolan Defense firm for my criminal case through word of mouth, which attests to their stellar character and reputation. When I first met Aneeq, his experience and calm demeanor really encouraged and helped me feel that I could trust him, which is crucial when it comes to attorney-client relationships.
I have wanted to become a doctor for years, and I was facing a very serious felony that held a very high maximum sentence of prison time as well as permanently ruining my dreams of attending medical school. I shared my goals of becoming a doctor with Aneeq, and he assured me he would do everything in his power to make sure this was possible.
Initially there was one serious felony charge, and the person pressing charges had purposefully falsified police reports, making it a very difficult case to fight. Aneeq worked very hard and spent hundreds of hours, bringing on multiple experts and private investigators to expose the lies this person had told, in order to defend me. Aneeq’s connections were very important in the success of my case, and having the extensive network and resources on hand speaks to Aneeq’s professionalism and skill.
Early on Aneeq noticed a crucial detail in my case that many other attorneys would have missed, and this led to many different facts of the case being discovered that really helped me. Additionally, recognizing this detail led to a witness coming forward and testifying on my behalf. Aneeq filed multiple motions throughout the case, many of them being pages long, and this gave us the opportunity to continue fighting the case. These motions that he filed were extremely meticulous and technical. Aneeq is one of the most detail-oriented people I have ever met, and he wrote these motions with precision and accuracy., giving us the best chance of success
Aneeq advised me not to take the plea’s that the prosecution offered, and advised me when to take the plea. His risk-assessment and analysis of a case's strengths and weaknesses is phenomenal, and this allowed me to secure an amazing result in this case. Aneeq and his team got the prosecutor to admit this case was a probation case, not a prison case, and to lower this serious felony to the lowest possible felony available. In sentencing, they got me ZERO jail time and expungement of all charges. This result will allow me to continue on my path towards medical school. I could not be happier with the results, and more impressed with Aneeq Ahmad, Michael Fuentes, another lawyer at his firm, and the rest of Aneeq’s team. I will recommend Aneeq to anyone I know who needs an attorney's services. Thank you all!!!
reviews.author: Joseph Raasch

reviews.text: Attorney Ahmad has helped my boyfriend through several cases for the past 4 years. He was very consistent in his defense. He didn’t judge us and he included our family. No one is perfect but everyone deserves a chance to grow and do better. Ahmad emphasized that and fought so that my family could do just that- grow and do better. reviews.text:
I HIGHLY recommend The New Mexico Expungement: A Subdivision of Peake Law Firm. Mr. Peake and his team are the BEST.

At the age of 20- back in 2009- I was arrested in Valencia County. The record of my arrest, although I was not conscious of it at the time, dramatically impacted my self-esteem. I self-destructed over the next couple of years until I decided to make a change.

After years of hard work and now a senior at UNM, I knew I needed to confront my past and get my record expunged in order to move forward into graduate school and become the woman I was born to be. The process was too difficult to confront alone ( I tried), so I contacted Mr. Peake and his brilliant team after being referred by UNM legal students.

Mr.Peake and his team took care of my case for next to nothing and I could not be more appreciative for their time and professionalism. They literally took care of everything while I continued to live my very busy life as a mother and student.

They truly wiped away the stain that once stood in the way of me and my dreams of one day becoming a mental health professional within the state I was born and raised, New Mexico. I am forever grateful.

reviews.text:
WOW,  THE BEST CRIMINAL  ATTORNEY IN ALBUQUERQUE, NEW MEXICO!!!

Me and my fiancee had to file Order of Protections against my "nut case of an ex wife and her daughter" after constantly being harassed, stalked, and threatened by phone, text, driving by our house, following us, even putting a forwarding address on our mail and getting into my bank account.

Needles to say, we are very satisfied with the outcome of mine and my fiancé's order of protection cases we filed again them. Mr. Mitchell went above and beyond... even though he knew this wasn't a couple ordinary cases due to the psycho individuals they are, he took our cases on immediately and stepped up to the plate and started batting for us. He's no BS, doesn't lie to you just to get your business, and even gave us advise on the process of what to expect from the DA's office on another case with my ex wife being prosecuted on harassment charges. As a formal District Attorney, he knows the criminal laws in New Mexico.

I can't thank Mitchell Law Office enough for all the hard work Aaron Mitchell and his paralegals put in before during and after the matter. Very attentive, professional, reliable, and you can really feel how passionate he is for you and your case. I've had an attorney in the past that I wondered if she was really advocating for me or my ex, not Mitchell though! If I called he would answer and did everything it took to achieve the desired result for my legal situation. From initial consultations to proceedings and then follow ups with reminders to submit my evidence and talk about the different outcomes that could take place, he was really on top of everything. I would highly recommend Mitchell Law Office to anyone needing legal representation for all your criminal representation needs, whether your the victim or perpetrated criminal.

He will be getting a highly sought-after review from me to the BARS Association of New Mexico! If I could give 10 stars, i would...Thank you again!!!!

After another law firm told us there was nothing they could do to expunge a criminal record because it was too old, we contacted Sam Salhab, and that was the best decision we made.
Sam was quick in his response and throughout the entire representation he worked hard and jumped through many hoops so that he could reach the outcome we needed.
He found out that the court had actually lost our file and therefore reopened our case to file a motion to dismiss, which was granted!
All of this happened with us being NC domiciliaries, and Sam being in CA. I must say, the communication and promptness to our case made it much easier to work with Sam than it is working with some of the other firms we have worked with locally!
If you're looking for an attorney to help with your criminal case, Sam is definitely the person to get you to the outcome you're looking for. He is very dedicated in his work and follows through with his word.
Thank you Sam for helping my dad take care of this record so that he can move forward with his citizenship application and our family can stay united.

reviews.text:
I was facing some serious charges an was very scared, I had no one to turn to. I was first given Ryan's number it was after hours I figured I would leave a message but he answered he listened to my whole story an made me feel like everything would be ok. By that next day he was already gathering evidence. Unfortunately covid hit and my case kept getting pushed back but anytime I needed something he answered or if I sent a email it was answered with in a few minutes. Ryan joined with David at some point during my case. The first time I spoke with David he new everything about my case I didnt have to fill him in on anything. For the duration of my case David had my back every step of the way. I calling him everytime I had a question or confused about something an he always answered, I was never pushed off to office staff to take questions of play muddle man I always talked to David directly. If it wasn't for David an Ryan I dont know what would have happened.  Now that my case is over an no jail time when I was facing 12 years or more. Ryan an David have still been there for me when I have questions even though they are no longer my attorneys. Dont waste your time on other attorneys that you are just another number. Choose a lawyer that truly cares an will do anything an everything they can to fight for you. I am beyond grateful that I found them.

UPDATE: it's been 3 years since my last review and have put everything in the past. I am back as a client. I went back to Ryan, David and his team because they are the only ones I can trust. I am working on having my past expunged/set aside. I know that they care about my case an what I have been through and how important this is to me. I am completely grateful for Stephanie who is always there to answer my questions and explain things to me. She has been there from the beginning along with Ryan and it's nice to have people that have supported me through this whole journey. I have seen some of the other reviews and it's saddens me that some people seem to have had a unpleasant experience. reviews.text: Byron handled a situation involving way overzealous police and a very aggressive DA's office, an office which seems to have completely lost sight of the fact that they work for the people, not the police. Even in the face of a judge, warning us during our day in court, "these kinds of motions are rarely, as in almost never granted", Byron got it done and we got our motion granted and record expunged.   I certainly have a more skeptical view of the police and DA's office after this, and  one thing we learned  for sure, don't roll over and let the system push you around.  Get a good attorney like Byron and fight for your rights and freedom.

reviews.author: Curtis Medina

reviews.text:
I made the mistake of drinking and driving in early 2019. Shortly thereafter, I found myself tangled up in the law searching for a competent legal team to represent me in what little did I know at the time would be a grueling, painful process, and in many ways it still is as i reflect back to a year ago when I was initially arrested.

Because the process is so painful its all the more important that you selectively choose a good lawyer. I found Saad law with no recommendation or much research, and fortunately for me my acorns landed at the root of a solid legal team that is personal and treats you like a human being.

I can truly say that with the assistance I have received from working with Steven and Caroline that I was not just a dollar to them. I have worked with them for a year now and have been with me every step of the way.  They are an open book, and at all times, whether its emails or phone calls or you just need someone to vent to about things, they are always their to make sure your questions are answered and your stress is put at bay.

Everyone is looking for the best possible results when it comes to matters of the law. My DWI was not expunged because plain and simple I was guilty as charged BUT, they were there to make sure that I was given a lesser sentence so that it did not destroy my life going forward. They knew my dreams and ambitions as an adult college student piecing his life back together after this unfortunate event and they kept that at the forefront of their strategy to ensure that whatever I faced didn't destroy the future I had in store for me.

They get to know you, they care about who you are and what you wish to do with your life and they do everything they can in their power to ensure whether your guilty or not that the conviction your facing is not going to limit the potential you have in store for yourself.

Not every case is won by erasing a DWI, but they can also be won in cases like mine where I was able to get a reduced sentence so that my future was not delayed in anyway. I owe my future to them and I could not feel more blessed or thank God enough that I accidentally found a great legal team to represent me.

Thank you very much!

Bryan
Raleigh, NC.

reviews.text:
Review for Attorney Marshall

I cannot speak highly enough of Attorney Marshall's exceptional professionalism, competence, and legal expertise. From the moment we engaged his services, he exhibited a remarkable balance of confidence and humility that immediately put us at ease. His deep knowledge of the law and ability to navigate complex legal situations were evident throughout the process. The charges in question were serious, but Attorney Marshall approached the case with unwavering dedication and precision. His ability to clearly explain the situation, provide sound counsel, and outline the best course of action gave us confidence during an incredibly stressful time.

Attorney Marshall's grace under pressure and fairness were equally impressive. He handled every aspect of the case with the utmost professionalism, ensuring all our concerns were addressed and that we felt supported at every stage. His skillful advocacy resulted in all charges being dismissed, a testament to his commitment to justice and his unparalleled legal acumen. Moreover, his services were economically fair, demonstrating that his priority lies in achieving the best outcome for his clients rather than personal gain.

What sets Attorney Marshall apart is his commitment to seeing the process through from start to finish. He not only secured the dismissal of all charges but also guided us through the expungement process to ensure the records were completely cleared. His thorough and meticulous handling of the case from the initial charge to final expungement provided us with a fresh start and a profound sense of relief. Attorney Marshall is truly an exceptional lawyer who cares deeply about justice and his clients' well-being. I highly recommend his services without hesitation.

reviews.text:
Jesse Scharff (and the Scharff Law Firm) is amazing beyond belief!
To summarize – here are reasons you should hire Jesse Scharff without delay:
1.  Jesse and Reba communicate well. This also goes for all the personnel in his office. Jesse and the Scharff Law firm do their best to answer your questions within 24 hours and they keep you informed through the whole process.
2. Jesse will not bullshit or sugarcoat you. He will be straightforward and let you know his thoughts and opinions about your case.
3. Jesse knows the Judges, the DA’s and all the people important in your case. He has the ability to spot weaknesses in the prosecution and the officers.
a. He will give you information to review – so you can review if you would like. In my case, I reviewed everything. I researched a ton and none of that mattered, because Jesse had it handled.
b. Jesse will also give you the standard information for you to do prior to your court case.
c.	Do what he says.  I finished all the classes, pre-work and community service before my first court case in preparation for the worst scenario.

Here are my reasons and why I say the above:

I hired Jesse for a DWI charge.  He was a recommendation from a friend, whom in her case had a different attorney she fired, in order to hire Jesse.  The Sunday morning after my arrest on Saturday, I called Jesse’s number, about an hour later, he called me and we spoke for about an hour.  In this initial conversation, I was impressed; not only by what he had to say, but also because of his demeanor and the steps he took to outline what I should do next.  Every time I met with Jesse, he was organized and on track.

Here is where Jesse’s experience and patience seals the deal.  When the DA was arguing my case, she went after everything, my demeanor, and my character and she presented a few incorrect facts and made broad and unclear assumptions.  Jesse leaned over to me and said, “All she is proving is that you were intoxicated” and that’s what she did.  After about an hour and thirty minutes, the DA only proved that I was intoxicated and could did not prove that I was driving or that I was complicit in any illegal activity.  Jesse got up and spoke for about three minutes to refute the evidence and said “Your Honor, we have no evidence my client was in the car, and much less driving.”

My case was dismissed and all charges dropped. My arrest and record were expunged and I have my life back.

The Scharff Law Firm is exactly what it is supposed to be. It’s not super fancy, glamorous or in a pretentious high rise building.   It’s perfect for an honest, hardworking firm. Jesse speaks to you as his friend & ally - always showing up to court to walk you through the process.

Jesse and the Scharff Law firm charge a fair and honest fee and the charge is worth every single penny!  Jesse sits down with you each time to give you instructions and his game plan.  Follow all of his (and his firms’) instructions.

I refer everyone to Jesse and would not hesitate to use him again.  I could not have asked for a better person to advocate on my behalf.  I trust Jesse and the Scharff law firm and I thank them for all their efforts.

reviews.text:
After running into some legal trouble, I went searching for an attorney to represent me in court. I made a few calls around town but Mr. Pfeiffer was the only attorney to answer his phone on a Saturday afternoon, and he took my call while at a sporting event for his child - much respect earned for that.

Mr. Pfeiffer not only answered my call, he took the time to answer all of my questions up front and even offered advice on what I should do even if I didnt decide to hire him. He offered me a flat rate charge, which would never increase even if additional follow-on services were needed after my initial court appearance. He charged an extremely competitive and fair price for his services.

Throughout the process of working with him,  he was very reassuring and had top-notch communication with me, always answering my calls and texts in a timely manner. Mr. Pfeiffer gave me a list of things to do, told me what proof to collect and what to bring to court.

On the date of my court appearance, Mr. Pfeiffer was able to get my case dismissed and I was in the court room for a matter of minutes. The entire process was quick and painless, I was shocked at how fast it was. I think I honestly asked him "That's it?" afterwards. Mr. Pfeiffer was also able to recommend me to a colleague for expungement processing at a discounted rate.

He made my entire experience with court easy and pain free, at a time when I felt scared and vulnerable. I can't recommend Stephen Pfeiffer highly enough and will definitely be using him in the future for any legal issues. You will not regret hiring him, he has definitely earned my five star review.

reviews.text:
This is officially the first review I've delivered any service provider.  After the experience I've had working with Ryan and Elizabeth, it would be wrong of me not to take the time to compose this review.  The work these folks do is second to none.  They are true technicians within the legal realm.  They understand 'the system'.  Above and beyond that however, they care.  Were there more stars available for this review, I would be sure to deliver each and every one of them....and without hesitation.  They are  well deserved.

Some background:  one of my family members is a police officer.  When I found myself in a troubling situation with the law, I immediately went to her asking for advice on an attorney.  Ryan and Elizabeth were recommended not only by her, but too, by a number of people on the Force.  As it turns out, it was for good reason.

Going into my case, my sister explained that the nature of my charges were going to make this a difficult case to 'win'.  In fact, it was hard.  Ryan and Elizabeth were there every step of the way.  And they were responsive every hour of the day.  And, in an industry ripe with 'frauds', they proved to be the real deal - true technicians.

Ryan was up front with me when we first met that this case wasn't going to be an easy one.  After a grueling and stressful number of months, Ryan and Elizabeth were able to get my case dismissed.  They were creative in their approach; and they didn't ever stop.

Recently, I wanted to get the case expunged.  Doing so should not have proven to be difficult given the 'continuance for dismissal' ruling I was delivered.  Turns out, it was hard indeed.  Due to the nature of my charges, we met some resistance within the system.  After an initial declination of our request, we revisited it.  And for what it's worth, taking a second stab at this wasn't ever a debate.  Elizabeth just jumped back in upon receiving the declination.  Just yesterday, I received a notification that the expungement request had been officially granted.  The records are sealed.  Ryan and Elizabeth beat the odds.  They lived up to the hype.

Again - there are not enough stars available to adequately frame up my satisfaction and appreciation with these two individuals.  If you're in need, you're in need - go meet with them.

*Also, as someone that reads reviews and gets regularly skeptical about those that are overly complementary, I want to make it clear that I don't know these two people.  I had no history with them before this case.  And outside of our business dealings, I don't maintain a relationship.  I am merely a satisfied consumer of their services.  I wouldn't hesitate in referring them (and have in fact done so twice now) to friends and/or family.

reviews.text: Hiring Chris for my expungement was The Best decision.    What a great experience.    I have had a “dark spot” on my record for 14 years. I googled “best expungement attorney ...” and found a list of people to sift through.   After speaking with several expungement attorneys in the twin cities area, I felt that Chris Keyser was the right fit for me.   He seemed very competent.   I’ve had a terrible experience with attorneys in the twin cities area in the past so I was very apprehensive and not confident this would go well for me even though Chris seemed great. I paid what I felt was a fair price and we proceeded with the expungement filing.   Chris kept me informed throughout the process and even when we had a hiccup come from left field with someone challenging my expungement Chris proceeded with professionalism, confidence and ample communication my way.  He also went above and beyond for me in the courtroom.  I was terrified of how this was going to go down but in the end, Chris won the case and my records have been sealed.  I’m finally free of this burden from my past.  Can’t thank you enough, Chris.  Highly recommend him to anyone looking for expungement.    A solid  5 stars and 2 thumbs up.
