**Review for Lawyer Kelly J. Keegan - Exceptional Expungement Services in Minnesota**

I am thrilled to share my experience and express my utmost gratitude to Lawyer Kelly J. Keegan for her outstanding efforts in helping me with the expungement of my record. Kelly is not just an attorney; she is a dedicated professional who goes above and beyond to achieve exceptional results for her clients.

From the very beginning, Kelly exhibited a level of commitment and expertise that immediately put me at ease. She thoroughly explained the entire expungement process, outlining the steps and potential outcomes, ensuring that I fully understood the implications and possibilities. This clarity and transparency in communication made me confident in her abilities.

What truly sets Kelly apart is her unwavering determination and hard work. She tirelessly worked on my case, leaving no stone unturned in her quest to secure a successful expungement. Her deep knowledge of Minnesota's expungement laws is remarkable, and she even played a pivotal role in shaping some of those laws. This is a testament to her dedication to not only her clients but also to the broader cause of justice.

Throughout the process, Kelly was not just my attorney; she was my advocate and ally. She demonstrated a genuine interest in my case, always keeping me informed and updated. Her personal approach and willingness to listen to my concerns made the journey smoother and less stressful.

In the end, Kelly's hard work paid off, and my record was successfully expunged. I couldn't be happier with the outcome, and it is all thanks to her exceptional skills and commitment to her clients.

I wholeheartedly recommend Lawyer Kelly J. Keegan to anyone seeking expungement services in Minnesota. Her professionalism, expertise, and dedication to her clients are truly commendable. If you want an attorney who will work relentlessly on your behalf and deliver outstanding results, Kelly is the one to trust. She is, without a doubt, an invaluable asset to the legal profession, and I am immensely grateful for her exceptional service. Thank you, Kelly, for helping me move forward with a clean slate and a brighter future.

listings.name: Justin T. Holt, Managing Attorney | Mallory, Lollar, Holt & Associates, P.C.

reviews.text:
Only my second time to have the need of an attorney. I was issued a citation because my car license number was recorded by someone who alleged my offense. Really weird deal, the offense was that I through trash into a dumpster that was owned by an apartment complex. This citation was a Class C misdemeanor but showed my offense as "Theft of Services". I have a squeaky clean record and this is type of word "Theft" on anyone's record could ruin any future possibilities of employment.
My initial contact was at the Arlington TX. office located on Cooper St. I was greeted by 2 hispanic ladies. I explained the situation to Mory. She was very patient as I tried to explain the whole thing and how important it was for me to fight this citation. Mory took a look at my citation and made several calls for me. She initially quoted me a price of $100 to handle the representation for this citation. She could tell that was more than I was hoping to pay. I was amazed as she made another phone call and advised me the cost would be $45. Mory was very observant to notice that I had reached the last day to notify the court of my plea. If I had gone past that day, there may have been a warrant issued for my arrest. Mory typed out some legal papers for me and I ran down to the municipal court, that day,  and had the not guilty plea filed verifying my attorney as Justin Holt. My whole experience with the Arlington office was excellent.
I received a call from the attorneys office approximately 2 weeks later following up on the citation. It was important to me to totally understand how the representation would be handled and if there would be any additional costs should I go to trial. Eventually, I found myself speaking with Justin Holt my attorney. Justin was excellent and patient explaining to me in layman's terms how he would handle the case and verifying that there would be no additional costs. Justin advised me that I would be notified within a few weeks about a possible trial date. Shortly thereafter, I received a letter that explained the upcoming events and called the office to verify. The office was very patient and explained clearly my appearance and where to meet at the municipal court. I met Justin Holt at the municipal court. Justin represented me with the judge. I was notified approximately 1 week later that the case or citation had been dismissed. The total cost for my attorney's service was $45. Can't say enough good things about this experience.
Just to verify, I do not know Justin Holt personally or anyone else associated with his firm. Just a satisfied customer that wanted to take the time to give kudos for a job well done..
reviews.author: Danny H

reviews.text: Albert helped me get my felony no billed, and my misdemeanor case dismissed. I’m looking forward to choosing him to help me get these expunged, really nice and professional.
reviews.author: Cynthia Saravia

reviews.text:
********I'm updating my review as I was requested to complete the review at the beginning of the case. Unfortunately my view in this law firm has completely changed.
This firm simply started the case, submitted paperwork for the PTI program and never followed through with anything else. My son's court officer went on leave and never returned. We tried to reach out to Austin as we were told to when I made my payment. But anytime I called I was given the runaround and told he was not available and that he would call back.. months and months of calling with no response.. I ended up having to hire a second law firm to get involved. My new lawyer simply went down to the court officers office and spoke to the supervisor to get the case moving as PTI has a time limit.. once the state had sent me the paperwork saying that PTI was complete my next step was to again reach out to the Fernandez law firm to then have the case expunged.. which I'm aware was an additional fee. I reached out to them time and time again and so did my son and every time once again there was another runaround.. either the system was down or the woman that handles expungements was not available.. another month of chasing them around with no recourse... So finally I went back to the other law firm and explain to them what was going on.. They once again took on my case for a fee.. If I had to do it all over again I would never ever use the Fernandez law firm I'm sorry they are just too irresponsible and don't give a damn about you after you pay them the fee. If I had not hired a second lawyer (after paying this firm and not getting what I paid for) to take over when they drop the ball my child would still have a felony.
reviews.author: Mechelle Mybell

reviews.text: Cat, our lawyer, was incredibly helpful during our difficult time. She was very understanding and willing to go that extra mile to make my wife feel comfortable through the process. The law office thought that the expungment would take 6 months or more, but we were able to get it done in half of that time. Truly great service. I hope we will never have to deal with these issues again but this firm is exceptional!!

Michael Braxton was a GOD sent and reccomend anyone to use if you want to be handled professionally and top tier. Thank you Michael Braxton and the entire firm.

reviews.text: Mr. Braxton and his team provided amazing assistance to me during a tough time. After getting arrested and charged with a DUI, I thought I was toast. Their office is very responsive and was pretty proactive on making sure everything ran smoothly with the pre-trial preparations. Get a lawyer if you can. reviews.text: I don't live in New Orleans, LA. but I had a record in Orleans Parish from 2007 for something I didn't do. I was young and thought it would go away because I wasn't from Louisiana. By me not living in New Orleans I couldn't handle things myself so I looked for a lawyer. After talking to a few different law firms, the clear choice was Crescent City Law. They suggested that I was qualified for an expungement and the process wouldn't take long. Crescent City Law explained to me the whole process of getting my record expunged, how long it would take and how it would help me. It only took 6 months and they communicated with me throughout the process to keep me in the loop. At the end I received a digital and hard copy of my expungement. I would like to thank everyone involved in the process of my expungement and for anyone looking for a Law firm that cares, choose Crescent City Law.

reviews.author: James bloxsom

reviews.text:
I don’t typically leave many reviews, but some time has passed to really delve into the positive effects that have occurred since Attorney Cate Purdum took on my case, that in the moments of waiting and getting done what was required, can easily be overlooked when the now mentality becomes the forerunner of the experience when such services are needed.

Without going too much into sensitive information, I will try to share a little about the help I received in regards to an incident that required myself to be separated from my family for about three months. During this time, the services of Patituce & Associates were acquired; Cate drove out to meet with me to help ease any discomfort and kept mostly in contact with me when necessary, though, I would have much preferred more updates or a general hello to remind me I wasn’t forgotten, but this was likely a situational feeling due to the separation.

The judge we had was extremely strict and wanted certain requirements to be completed now, but due to time restraints and the order of which things could be done and when they could be done, we had to be patient and file for motions of continuance.

As this was happening, Cate, and at one point, one of her colleagues, would meet with the prosecutor and myself at each court date with necessary evidence, updates, and advocacy and go before the judge; the charge against me would have been a felony and time served. Though the case was not dismissed, the charge was dropped to a minor misdemeanor with the ability to expunge the verdict from my record after six months, something I plan to do in the future, and no probation.

I’m very grateful for the work put into my case, and for the length, as it gave everyone time to do what they needed and gave me time to receive the therapy I wasn’t ever really able to undergo to heal and learn from childhood trauma and the likes. I’m happy to text, that due to this work we all put in, I have now established two jobs without any issue and I am able to confidently and courageously volunteer within my community and be a growing mother and companion to my family.

You have my sincerest thanks, Patituce & Associates.

With much respect,
J. Bright
reviews.author: Jessica Bright

reviews.text: We paid 2500 for a simple expungement in August 2024. It's January 2025 with multiple calls to office requesting to speak to Attorney Justin Weatherly. He has yet to call us back
reviews.author: Kathryn Burke

reviews.text:
I would definitely recommend HMW Law, to anyone who needs a phenomenal defense lawyer.  We hired Justin Weatherly and honestly we spoke and met with many law firms and he was the best choice. Things happen in life , sometimes just being
At a place at the wrong time and when you are uncertain of what the outcome will be, it is very stressful.  He took the time to thoroughly explain everything.  He was very blunt and truly did  everything he said he would.  He made sure to get every piece of evidence from police reports, body cam footage, all the way up to being booked in the jail from a couple hours prior to the arrest and after.  He told us exactly what could happen and genuinely listened to us.  While he usually does what I guess some would consider big crimes such as murder and federal cases.. he took my boyfriends case just as seriously as he did with so many others- I did a lot of research.  Not just Google reviews..I looked up dockets to similar cases.  Ours would have been a weapons under disability which would have been an F3. (I only share this because i know with reviews some want to know if their situation is similar) and we got the best outcome that could have happened. We ended up with an ammended charge of a misdemeanor and he also is helping get his record expunged so he can truly put his past behind him.  That part depends on prior charges and i think only f3s and lower. I know many have stated that he is expensive... but you get what you pay for. This law firm and Justin is worth every last cent.   He didn't promise or try to sell himself.. he was blunt, thorough, and respectful. Told us everything that could happen. He defends evidence... not just what someone says happened.  He is very respected in the court. Honestly (while we hope to never need Mr. Weatherly again) .. he would be the first and only lawyer we would contact again.  We are so grateful for all that he did for us.  If you or someone you love find yourself in a troubling legal situation- Justin Weatherly and Hmw law is definitely the defense team you want fighting for you.
reviews.author: tiffany kon

reviews.text:

He will respond and return your calls, and will reply to your Emails, Text message... even on weekends best lawyer ever!!!!!! He got me through the process of getting my record expunged, ensuring that the case would no longer haunt me in the future. The expungement process can be complex, but Aaron provided invaluable support and handled everything outside of me writing a letter to the judge. I wholeheartedly recommend Aaron Brockler to anyone in need of legal representation. His professionalism, expertise, and unwavering dedication make him a top-tier attorney. I am truly grateful to have had him by my side, and I can confidently say that I will never hire anyone else for any legal matters. reviews.text: I caught a criminal felony case in a very questionable county and was afraid I would be facing a guranteed prison sentence with my prior record and the circumstances of my new case. His paralegal team was awesome and took care of me and made sure I understood the process of everything when Myron was unavailable. I want to thank not only him but his team also as I pleaded to a charge I was okay with and took probation with an option to have my record expunged 1-3 years after my verdict. Thank you to the Watson team and hopefully I never do but if I do ever need help again he will be the first person I call. He’s a man of his word. reviews.text:
Having a matter of 22 years old needing Expungement . I reached out to The Koenig Law Office.  I had the pleasure of speaking with Bo and his staff. Who are all simply
A-MAZING!  I must say I asked Bo how quickly this matter could be addressed as I was looking for a different career path and no longer wanted this to be my dark cloud that has faithfully been there with every door opening and slamming on me as quickly. Bo explained he could have this filed in court, appear in court for me
I do not need to be present.  Have it  expunged, completed and rather quickly too which I was happily surprised!

reviews.text: I would have given less than 1 star if offered, for one when he was first hired I was incarcerated and he never came to see me he sent an investigator. It was wise for me to appear at every hearing because he was working against me  I have a record and he couldn’t move pass that being an ex district attorney even though I confessed my innocence. I provided him evidence and he claimed he lost it. Mr. kyle Humphrey kept telling me to get in touch with his investigator and when I did he didn’t know what I was talking about. I informed him that I wanted a speedy trial and he misinformed me on what they could do to me without a witness or a victim just on a statement that was made. After fully paying him to represent me I had to go outside of his firm for accurate information. He tried to have me pay 80k for a trial and said he needed 40 k down I went with someone else and they got the charges dropped in 2 court sessions and Mr. Lyle Humphrey had me convinced that if I didn’t agree to everything he wanted me to do that I was facing life. reviews.text:
Made the mistake of using him twice now.. He promises you the world but once they get your money they give you the cold shoulder. Communication drops off right after you sign the paperwork and pay... He said he'd keep me out of jail and that wasn't true... He does the work and then boasts about how much work he did when he fails... At my arraignment he was literally shaking and his voice was cracking when the judge was trying to remand me from bail I paid twice...If I wanted someone to hold my hand through court I would have went with a Public Defender or a much cheaper lawyer. He will never take your case to trial so unless you have some crazy loop holes in your case I wouldn't even try it... DUI is one of the only crimes where the jury gets knowledge of previous DUIs so he simply won't take your case to trial with previous DUIs. If it's your first then a public defender will get you the same as he will... Total waste of money but if you're a Barbie looking Rosedale individual he will get you off. I watched him get someone off Scott free that was going to court with during my DUI court dates... I could hear what they were discussing in the hallway before court and this woman's DUI was much worse than mine... Im sure they make deals with the DAs on which get off and who's going to be the sacrificial lamb. Do yourself the favor and get a public defender if it's your first or second.

He also failed miserably on my expungement too... Before I paid him he swore up and down he could get it 100% expunged which wasn't true.. After our last court date he informed me that expungement is "discretionary" which he didn't explain while we signed the paper work. If I knew it was going to be a gamble I wouldn't have forked over the money. I would never use this guy again or even refer him to anyone.

reviews.author: raymond watts

reviews.text:
I was referred to Attorney James Gempeler at Northstar Criminal Defense by a close friend of mine. I was looking to have my DWI record expunged due to charges from 13 or 14 years ago. I had run into issues with finding employment, apartments, etc. as a result of my criminal record, and mistakes I had made when I was much younger. I didn't have much hope that I could successfully have my record expunged because I had previously talked to an attorney who told me that it was not possible. So I called James without high expectations, and met with him within a couple of days.

James was very honest and transparent with me about the potential hurdles, but assured me he was up for the challenge. He was very well educated about expungement law, and was citing sources that might be applicable to our case. He guided me step-by-step through the entire process letting me know what to expect and how to mentally prepare. He was fantastic during our court appearance. He had clear knowledge of all of the nuances of my case and was able to articulate them accurately to the judge and the opposing attorney.

This was a very emotional process for me, as I have a lot of shame surrounding the pour choices I made when I was younger - so much so that I have dedicated my professional career to helping individuals and families affected by addiction. And I was grateful that James always treated as a human being with compassion and respect. I never once felt judged for my mistakes.

I am thrilled to say that we got the outcome we had hoped for thanks to James' hard work. My record will officially be sealed, and I will be able to move forward and continue to help more people who struggle without being held back by my criminal record. When I found out the court found in my favor, I sobbed for almost an hour as I had believed this would be something that would haunt me for the rest of my life. To have this burden removed from my shoulders so that I can continue to be a positive contributor to society is a freedom I didn't expect to know. I am confident to say I won't need James' services in the future from criminal defense or expungement representation, but I would gladly recommend him to anyone looking to move forward from previous legal mistakes.
reviews.author: Jessica Wong

reviews.text: I am a personal injury attorney in Minnesota.  When clients, family, or friends need criminal defense or expungement help, I refer them, without hesitation, to James Gempeler at North Star Criminal Defense.  I trust Attorney Gempeler, and everyone whom I have referred has reported exemplary service.  I am continually impressed with Attorney Gempeler's expertise and results for his clients.  .
reviews.author: Lindsay Keller

listings.address: 1295 Bandana Blvd N Suite 335, St Paul, MN 55108

reviews.text:
In early 2022 my 21-year-old son was arrested and charged with 7 felonies and his bail was set at a million dollars.  His Public defender encouraged him to take a 1st degree sales charge right away.  I called around a handful of criminal defense attorneys that quoted me outrageous fees to retain their services and the tone in their voices seemed so grim.

Everything changed when I contacted Repka Law.  Dan called me back the same day.  He was so upbeat, positive, and ready to take on the task of getting the best possible outcome for my son.  It was 3 days before my son’s next hearing and Dan said immediately he wanted to be there to let it be known that my son would not be rolling over to a plea deal - and that he would fight for my son as if he were his own.  Needless to say, he got the job!

My son’s case took over a year in District Court–in that time Dan filed several motions to try and have his bail reduced and to ask for opportunities for him to go to treatment (he had everything lined up and ready if they agreed).  Each motion was denied, and we all were getting frustrated and feeling defeated, but Dan never gave up the good fight or lost hope.  Dan and I were in regular communication, and he called me before and after every hearing; to say I texted him a lot over the past few years would be an understatement :) He was always super responsive and supportive. He also had regular legal calls with my son throughout the entire process.

After Dan had looked over the evidence, or lack thereof, he concluded in his opinion that the search warrant lacked probable cause and the entire case should be dismissed.  The district court disagreed.  My son ended up not accepting any plea, was found guilty at a court trial on 1 charge of 2nd Degree Possession and sentenced to 48 months in prison.

Dan subsequently filed an appeal and argued my son’s case at the MN Court of Appeals like a RoCkStAr!! We lost a lot of battles along the way in District Court, but Dan ultimately won the war – and with a Precedential Published opinion at that! Justice prevailed!  My son’s entire conviction was reversed/vacated and he was able to walk out of Prison after 27 months of incarceration-  free from any type of supervision or parole and is now starting the process of getting his civil rights restored and the immediate expungement from his record.

My family will forever be grateful for Dan –  I cannot thank him enough for never giving up and for seeing this to the end. I consider him a dear friend and trusted confidant.  I honestly could not have made it through all of this without his kindness, support, wisdom, patience, empathy, and great sense of humor.   Dan knows the law; he has the endurance to keep fighting fearlessly for your rights and is not intimidated to face any legal battle. If you find yourself in a fight against any criminal charge Dan is who you want and need by your side!

His staff Mary and Andrea were also very respectful and supportive throughout this entire ordeal and deserve a shoutout as well!  Thank you all for everything!

reviews.text:
I hired this firm to take care of a traffic matter for me in Orange County because I live about two hours away. The ticket was written in the wrong name from the registration even though I was the only individual in the car. When I spoke with the attorney for the consultation I was assured I would not have to appear in court if i singed an affidavit.
When I was sent the affidavit there were multiple spelling errors that I had to correct before signing it and returning it to the office.
In the end, both I and the other person on the registration had to appear in court. This was because there was a discrepancy between what the citation stated and what the attorney stated in court. They had to subpoena the Trooper to court.
The attorney then showed up over a hour late to court and did not greet us or speak to us until our case was called. The ticket was dismissed due to the Trooper not appearing, but I should have saved my money and handled it myself. When I asked about an expungement, they wanted us to pay more for that than the ticket itself. Working in a law firm myself, this sounded ridiculous and the situation was not handled well.
The only reason I am giving two stars is because London was a wonderful assistant.

I highly recommend Attorney Wiseman he is professional, honest, truthful, caring, gentle, kind, compassionate, faithful and returns calls (so does his wonderful staff) he also went above and beyond the call of duty to help us when we didn't know where to turn. I thank Vincent for his expertise and hard work and really am glad he's there to help out idiots like me!

reviews.text: For the past 2 years, I had my DUI conviction hanging over my head. As a recent college graduate entering the workforce, I dreaded the idea of having to disclose my conviction. While doing research about ending my probation early and expunging my record, I came across Adam Stull's firm  which focused on what I was looking for. From the first time I spoke with Adam, he was very attentive and responsive to my needs. He was willing to meet in a location that was more convenient for me to discuss my case which not everyone is willing to do. My court date was set for mid March which is when COVID-19 and all the courts closed. At the time, I filled with anxiety as I was running out of time before I had to apply for jobs. However, Adam comforted me and let me know that he would make sure that my case would be first on the docket as soon as the court would allow it. On July 1st, my second court date to terminate my probation early, the court decided that my case was not a priority and would delay it until late September. Of course, Adam worked diligently to get me a date for early august. Fast forward to today, September 29, 2020, my probation has been terminated early and record has been expunged all because of Adam Stull. Despite the setbacks that were out of our control, he worked hard and made sure that this was a smooth stress free process for me.
reviews.author: Ms. Ramirez

reviews.text: I have nothing but greatness to say about Attorney Terry! While at the Municipal Court hearing she found a flaw in the case that nobody but her noticed and she was quick to bring it up and was able to get the whole case dismissed!! and just recently I received paperwork in the mail for all charges to be expunged!!! listings.name: Minick Law, P.C.

reviews.text:
Thanks for getting my case dismissed before the court date! Attorney Gint, you're the best!

I don't typically write reviews / not big fan of it. However, Gint's service compelled me to share my experience, hoping it helps others in similar situations.

I recently received a citation in Wilmington for failure to yield the right of way. As this was my first ticket, I contacted several attorneys. With most firms, I only spoke to receptionists or assistants who took notes but never connected me with an attorney, despite my preference for direct communication. Again I am not against of speaking with the Legal Assistants but its always good to speak with the person who will represent on your behalf at the court.

After speaking with various firms, I connected with attorney Gint. What stood out from our first conversation was how patiently he listened to my situation. He explained all possibilities, from best to worst-case outcomes, including how the ticket would impact insurance and DMV points. He addressed all my questions during that first interaction and suggested documents that could help get the case dismissed.

After a couple of weeks, I gathered all the information and retained him. He was very prompt in responding to calls and emails, maintaining clear communication throughout the process. His organizational and documentation skills are excellent. Even after retaining him, he continued to respond promptly to all my questions and maintained the utmost professionalism with a sense of ownership and clarity. He clearly cares for his clients.

He suggested a plan of action and, using New Hanover County's new e-court system, documented my case and evidence. He successfully got my ticket dismissed well before the court date, saving me from having to travel to NC since I'm not a resident. He even offered to help with the expungement letter paperwork at no additional cost. He is a kind and empathetic person.

I highly recommend retaining him without hesitation if he's willing to take your case. If he sees merit in your case, trust his guidance and follow his input completely. Happy to talk to you if you have any questions.

reviews.text:
I highly recommend Dan Smith and San Diego Defenders to anyone in need of legal assistance. Dan and his team have not only proven to be extraordinarily capable, but they also vest themselves in their clients well being on a personal level.

Over the last 3 years my family and I have lived through a very unfortunate situation that, like many, became much more complicated than necessary once authorities became involved. I have great respect for the police and our legal system, this just wasn't a case that required their involvement. What should have been a simple intervention for addiction became an exaggerated criminal accusation with the State seeking maximum life altering sentences.

My wife and I were very fortunate to have had Dan recommended to us and from the very beginning Dan did all that he could do to defend our son from an over-zealous DA. Dan was successful in reducing or clearing some of the charges, although a single felony remained despite his valiant efforts.

This is were most attorneys would have given themselves a pat on the back and called it a day, but not Dan. He cared! He continued to fight to help for the early release of our Son to an addiction treatment center which Dan found HIMSELF!

Our Son has had a complete turn around in his life, due greatly to Dan and his team's involvement! Even then, our Son had the stigma of a Felony record that has stymied much of his ability to move forward...

Until today! Today my wife, our Son and I attended court with Dan's associate Jon who successfully argued for the State to expunge our Son's record!!! Dan's team has yet again gone above and beyond so as to allow us to recover from a past mistake and instead have the ability to look forward to a much brighter future!

Thank you to everyone at San Diego Defenders! We will always be grateful!

reviews.text:
Niko is such a great guy. He knows the process, figures out your best options, takes the time to fully understand your situation, and works with you and your family to make it through all of the hoops you may not even know exist. He does a lot of the backend work and keeps that away from you, so that you and your families are able to focus on getting your lives together after a traumatic moment in your lives. His staff is friendly, always accommodatin, and they work to find the solution to anything you bring to their table, always with you and your best interests in mind. Trust is huge with any attorney, and sometimes what's best for you, isn't what you want, or think it is. Niko and his staff work diligently to make sure you comprehend the process well, and help you understand your best options dependent upon the court, the judge, and your action.

My time with him is invaluable and I appreciate all the work he did for me and especially, my family, in my greatest time of need. He kept it together for me, even when I flew off the handle a little and I owe him my life.

He also helps with expungement processes and charges a very fair price for the work. After that's over and done with, I'll never come back here again! 😉 Except maybe just to say, "hello!"

reviews.text: Attorney Seth Shapiro is excelllent!  From the very first phone call to the eventual ‘expungement,’ Mr. Shapiro guided me through a stressful process with the utmost professionalism, care & attention to detail. He understands the nuances & intricacies of the system better than anyone & is very well respected by his colleagues - judges, state attorneys, clerks etc. Attorney Shapiro and the Morris Law Firm team will strategically & strongly advocate for you to ensure the best possible outcome so you can move on with your life! Highly recommend.
reviews.author: Seth Taylor

reviews.text: I was arrested, and charged with misdemeanor domestic battery in Pinellas County on a Friday. I did my research for legal help that lead me to Seth Shapiro and the Morris Law firm based on all of the positive reviews and outcomes with cases similar to mine. I called Seth that Sunday, he not only returned my call within minutes, but before the day was out Seth was signed up to represent me. From that day forward Seth took charge, explained every step and all of my options along the way. I opted for the County's domestic violence diversion program for anger management rather than a trial. The end result for me after successfully completing a 12 class program within 2 months is that all charges have been dropped and my case is closed. Seth is now working on getting my arrest record expunged and when processed there will be no record that this unfortunate incident ever happened. What more could you ask of an attorney! If you need this kind of help, call Seth Shapiro if you want the best legal solution to your problem.
reviews.author: David

reviews.text: I was charged with a Domestic Battery and 2 misdemeanor batteries in Pinellas County, Florida. I live in New York and was down there on vacation. A very prestigious lawyer in New York City highly recommended the Morris Law Firm in St. Petersburg FL to me. My attorney Seth Shapiro was proficient at his job and relentless in his pursuit to get this case dismissed. Seth proved to the D.A. that upon further investigation of this case by the State Attorney's Office it was revealed that further prosecution was not warranted. My case was Nolle Prosequi, which means it was dismissed by the prosecution. This was the best outcome I could of have ever wished for. On top of that my arrest record is on its way to being expunged. What an amazing Law Firm. Seth Shapiro was caring, and forthright with me. I would highly recommend Seth Shapiro and the Morris Law Firm to anyone who needs legal representation.  Sincerely, Josh M.

reviews.text: My future was in the hands of attorney William A. Proetta  . I was charged with shoplifting at a store in Union City  A charge that could have ruined my reputation and future for a lifetime if convicted . I called his office and he immediately returned my call from his cell phone  I explained to him the details of my case and also told him there was a 1,500 dollar bail . With no hesitation he spoke to the prosecutor and judge and I didn’t have to pay for the bail he was able to set up a court day for me . On my court day my charge was dismissed in less than 20 minutes and he made the arrangements to get the charge expunged from my record  I can’t thank him enough . I highly recommend Attorney  Proetta  .   As a result of his excellent performace and representation , he has been sentenced to be my attorney for a lifetime with no parole . Thanks again Mr. Proetta.

Michael is extremely down to earth. In speaking with him, you can sense his sincerity and passion. He will speak to you as if you and he are equals without casting judgement. He answered every question I had, both related and unrelated to my case, and outlined the process and what to expect perfectly. He took the time to understand who I am/the particulars of my case and then quickly tailored the best approach possible based on that to suit my needs. He is also very easy to reach, not that you’ll feel like you need to as he checks in and updates you with any news/progress. He is extremely knowledgeable and a true professional who has perfected his craft. My expungement was granted without any issues and even went through quicker than anticipated, which is especially impressive during the backlog of court cases this pandemic has created.

I highly recommend using Michael Pastacaldi as your attorney and only wish I had found him earlier. Thank you for everything Michael!!

reviews.text: My son was charged with a felony and four misdemeanors. Mr. Mehlos worked very hard on the case and an plea was reached with only two misdemeanors and deferred protection and after 1 year they will be expunged. Thank you so much Corey for your hard work.
reviews.author: Gerald Kleinhans

reviews.text: I would like to Thank the Casper Mehlos law group for their excellent work.  Especially Attorney Mr.Corey Mehlos. I was charged with one felony (F) count and four class (A) misdemeanors with the max sentence of 16 years! Early on ATTY. Mehlos offered a plan in regards of getting this case down to a deferred prosecution and potentially expunged off my record. All said and done we ended with a deferred prosecution plea to two class (A) misdemeanors and after 12 months of good behavior on bond, it will be expunged from the records with no jail time!! Exactly what we had planned from the get-go! Definitely would recommend them to others. Thank you all involved for the great experience, couldn't have asked for a better turnout!!
reviews.author: Jerry Jr

reviews.text: My family hired Corey to help me with a really serious situation. Due to a mental health issue I was involved in a very dangerous car accident with an off duty police officer. I almost died. I did not mean to hurt anyone except myself and I needed help. I was charged with 2 felony and 3 misdemeanor charges and Corey really helped me along the way with both giving me an opportunity to get all my charges expunged off my record if I successfully completed probation and also to figure out a program where I could work on my issues so nothing like this ever happened again. I felt absolutely horrible that someone else got hurt in the accident but it was a challenge to work through the stress of the case. But only did Corey help me get the chance to not have my life timed by felony charges, he was there for me and helped me figure out the right help. The DA was really aggressive at times and I think we took one or two weeks of court because he would fight with Corey over just about everything, but Corey didn’t back down an inch and I always felt he had my  back. I now find myself in a much better place and appreciate everything Corey did to help me get a second chance in life. Corey wasn’t just our attorney, he became a good friend and I couldn’t be more grateful that we found him.
reviews.author: Brady Valleskey

reviews.text: HELLO I WOULD LIKE TO RECOMMEND THE SERVICES OF THIS LAW FIRM, GREAT JOB!!!! I GOT A TICKET FOR SPEEDING 16-19! I HAVE A CDL!! MY TICKET WAS CHANGED!! AND I STILL HAVE A CLEAN RECORD!!! THE BEST OF THE BEST!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.author: Mike Gajewski

reviews.text:
I received a speeding ticket in Wisconsin for driving 24 miles + in Lions county. I am from Illinois.  Contacted the Johnen law firm and was given a lot of assurances. Was said they will work with the attorney to possibly reduce or void the entire ticket because of my complete clean records.
All documents were timely submitted by them, no issues. After 6 weeks, I reached out of anxiety and they again assured that even if the judgement is not in our favor, we can appeal and try to reduce the fine further. There will be ample scope for negotiations.

2 months went by and received a decision from attorney directly in mail. The speeding fine was reduced only by 1 category, because of clean record. From $300 to $200+. When I enquired with attorneys to possibly appeal, they mentioned that it is not possible. I was told that their only objective was to avoid a suspension.
I have no issues with paying fine, but I have issue with lying. When I hired them, they had set completely different expectations and also lied in the middle during my enquiry. Later after outcome, they changed the tune . I know I cant argue with lawyers, but being non truthful is not a good sign.  Also, I was clarified that during the entire process there was no real negotiation with public prosecutor. They just submit documents and wait for a response or result.
reviews.author: Arabinda Subudhi

reviews.text: Seems like a good person. Gave me great advice over the phone for nearly 30 minutes. I was inquiring about an expungement issue and he was very knowledgable in this matter. Although he advised me that a lawyer wasn't needed, I still wanted to hire him!

reviews.text: David Anderson is top notch! He works hard on your behalf and is compassionate and really LISTENS to what you are saying. Went in with 4 felony charges and came out with 3 misdemeanors that will be expunged after the 2 year probation period so it will be as though it never happened. IF YOU WANT JUSTICE AND WANT PROPER DEFENSE CHOOSE DAVID ANDERSON SERIOUSLY. He also is the only fairly priced attorney around and won't try to get over on you just because and will FIGHT FOR YOU UNTIL THE END. I and my family deeply thank you Mr. Anderson!-

reviews.text: I highly recommend this lawyer. Out of all the trials that day, me and another client of his were the only ones that are going to be able to get our records expunged! I truly do believe things would not have gone so well if I had a different lawyer.

reviews.text: They were great, always provided me with up-to-date information on my case, while still letting me make my own decisions. My case was dismissed and I will be a returning customer to have that expunged.
reviews.author: Caden Trice

reviews.text: In 1998 I was in trouble and didn't know much about law. We paid thousands for our lawyer to upfront and completely explain the choices he advises us to accept. Lanehart said for me to accept a plea with deferred adjudication. I understood that as long as i complete without problems , that my conviction would not show up ..only an arrest. Well let me tell you it doesn't say nothing about arrest , it shows I pled guilty and was sentenced to deferred adjudication for my charges. Ever since my life has been hell filled with disappointment after disappointment with jobs turning me down for a 25 year old guilty plea that I thought details would be vague and only show I was arrested! I was arrested as a 19 year old in 98 and I'm 50 now and I keep losing opportunities for jobs even this long after. It was my first offense , I was eligible for probation on that merit alone , when the main defendent explained it was only him and he got decades but tried to show that I wasnt guilty just gave a guy a ride and he chose to do it himself and looking back, i feel chuck chose to plead me and didnt offer to go to court had i gotten convicted , id still have  deffered adjudication but i could of expunged my record but because i pled guilty i cant have it expunged and because i didnt understand the magnitude of my choice i cannot find employment . Lanehart left me destroyed.
reviews.author: Cisco

reviews.text: Mr. Sparling was very profession and straight forward. He didn’t promise me a rose garden, but he did promise that he will do everything he can for the best result and be an aggressive negotiation. I was glad I hired him, and he took over my case not even a week before my second pretrial conference. He was able to do a quick proper turnover with the previous attorney. He also kept the line of communication open and answered all my questions. I became very confident with him representing me in my case from day one. On my third pretrial conference he explained in detail multiple approaches to get the best result. He was able to negotiate a diversion in my case which I was very grateful, and it allowed me to be able to have a clean record so I will always be able to provide for my daughter in her future. I will highly recommend Mr. Sparling and is the best representation of Rosenstein Law Group.
reviews.author: IsmaelQuiebras

listings.name: Tamou Law Group Criminal Defense & DUI Lawyers - Scottsdale

reviews.text: I was involved in an unfortunate accident that resulted in me getting arrested at the Phoenix Sky Harbor airport for felony trespassing. upon release I had to find a lawyer to try and fight my case. I called around to five different law firms and was treated like a customer at a car dealership and not a real person. I also never spoke to an actual lawyer -- only the legal assistants or associates -- and on top of that the average retainer was anywhere between $7,500-$12,000 just to get my case started. I truly felt like they didn't care about me at all.... After struggling to find a lawyer that I felt comfortable with representing my case, I reached out to Mike at Tamou Law Group and was honestly blown away!! not only did I speak with Mike directly the first time I called, but I genuinely felt as though he cared about me and getting me the lowest punishment possible. He also said that he would take on my case for only $5,000!! I decided to go with Mike  and it was the best decision I could've ever made! he was responsive the entire process and made sure I understood everything that was going on the whole time. due to his previous experience as a public defender, he was able to get my case pushed through to the felony diversion program almost immediately which meant I didn't have to return for court and that upon completion of the diversion program the charge would be expunged from my record! on top of that, I was being civilly sued by the Department of Homeland Security which was a separate case from the one that I originally hired Mike for. I was facing a $15,000 fine and had to write a letter to DHS explaining my case and the events that had taken place the night of the arrest. Mike went above and beyond for me by assisting with my letter and got me waived of all fines!! I could not be happier with my decision to have Mike represent me. if you or someone you know is in some unfortunate legal trouble, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND Mike Tamou at Tamou law group. it was seriously the best $5,000 I have ever spent!!! Thank you again Mike!!

Additionally, I had just retired from the Army, after 20 years of service, with a very clean record and I wanted to keep it that way.  Mr. Monarrez and Ms. Lopez were in constant communication with me (via phone AND email) and they effectively explained complicated legal issues in an easy-to-understand manner.  They were frequently keeping me informed of any updates and all of my options.  This team of lawyers and legal assistants has surpassed the many lawyers and legal assistants that I have dealt with in the past (due to divorce and child custody).  They are well worth the money spent and I would highly recommend them to any family and friends looking for remarkable legal services.  I am so grateful for Mr. Monarrez, Noemi Lopez, and the entire R&R Law Group for their incomparable professionalism.  Thank you so much!!!

reviews.text: I hired these lawyers and gave them all my information and court date. They didn't show up. I had to call them because I received a letter from the municipal court that nobody showed up and had 10 days to appeal the decision, which they did. The second mistake they made was they tried to send me to the wrong courthouse, Frank Crowley Courts Building, when my trial was in the Municipal Court. Then a lawyer from there called me and said that the court tried to negotiate with me and dismiss one ticket and pay for the other one and I wouldn't have to go to trial if I accepted, and he kept insisting that my trial was on Friday 08/09 when it was actually on Thursday 08/08. I would've missed my trial if I listened to him. Then, they insisted on me accepting the courts offer, but I insisted and made them go to trial because that's why I hired them, to dismiss both my tickets and expunge from my record, which they had initially agreed to. Now I showed up to court and got my two tickets dismissed which I was innocent of from the beginning. A few days later they sent me an email, saying that if someone were to dig my record they would still show up unless they were expunged. So I called the Lawyer Megan and she said I had to pay around $800 more to have that expunction, which I had initially already paid and hired them for, I just can't believe I went through all this.
reviews.author: eric gutierrez

reviews.text: We were referred to JBABB Law through a colleague of Jason’s who went to law school with him. This colleague unfortunately does not do ticket cases, but assured us that JBABB would take exceptional care of us which they absolutely did! My partner was extremely stressed over a citation he received and we were adamant about getting it dismissed. From the first phone-call, Brooklyn, the legal assistant, was incredibly educated about his legal matter & thorough when guiding him through what to expect & what steps he needed to take. Many attorney offices will simply throw out sales pitches while sugar coating the details, but Brooklyn offered realistic feedback while maintaining an optimistic outlook and approach. Poor communication or lack thereof is one of the most common frustrations when working with an attorney/attorney’s office so we were beyond pleased when we received consistent, punctual, & concise communication from beginning to end with JBABB firm, & notably, Brooklyn G. When the day of the hearing came, we were met at the courthouse by Jason’s associate, attorney Alan Perez. He had already executed some of the process on my partner’s behalf before we arrived & informed him of what he was to expect & how to proceed to conclude the hearing. He was very professional and easy to engage with. We were relieved and grateful when my partner’s ticket was dismissed!! Next step is working to get an expungement which he will certainly be using JBABB for as well. We are highly impressed & can confidently recommend this firm to anyone who needs someone to fight for them & with them!

reviews.text:
I had the pleasure of speaking with Attorney Jordan Copeland recently, and I must say that he exceeded all my expectations as a criminal defense attorney in Alabama. From the very beginning, his professionalism, knowledge, and dedication to his clients were evident, making my experience with him truly exceptional.

When I reached out to Attorney Copeland, I was immediately impressed by his prompt response. He not only answered my phone call but also took the time to address my questions and concerns thoroughly. This level of attentiveness and genuine care for his clients' needs is what sets Attorney Copeland apart from the rest.

Throughout our interactions, Attorney Copeland displayed a remarkable depth of legal expertise, especially in the areas of pardons and expungements. His extensive experience in criminal defense law in Alabama became evident as he guided me through the complexities of my situation, ensuring I fully understood my rights and options. He was patient, attentive, and empathetic, making me feel reassured during a challenging time.

What truly stands out about Attorney Copeland is his unwavering commitment to his clients. He genuinely cares about achieving the best possible outcome for them, and it shows in his meticulous approach to every case. He listened intently to my concerns and tailored his strategies accordingly, providing personalized guidance that instilled a sense of confidence in me.

Moreover, I greatly appreciate his transparent and honest communication style. Attorney Copeland kept me well-informed about the entire process, ensuring I understood the potential risks and benefits of each decision. He demonstrated a remarkable ability to explain complex legal concepts in a way that was easy for me to grasp, empowering me to make well-informed choices.

Based on my exceptional experience, I wholeheartedly recommend Attorney Jordan Copeland to anyone facing legal issues, particularly in the realm of criminal defense. Whether you need assistance with a pardon, expungement, or any other legal matter, he is undoubtedly the attorney to rely on. His dedication to upholding justice and protecting his clients' rights is unparalleled.

In the unfortunate event that I ever require legal representation in the future, I will undoubtedly turn to Attorney Copeland without hesitation. Thank you, Attorney Copeland, for your exceptional service, ability and unwavering commitment to justice. You have my highest recommendation!

--Jeff

listings.name: Fiandach & Fiandach

reviews.text:
If you’re looking for a top notch attorney to represent you for DWI, look no further! I speak from experience when I can confidently say that Fiandach & Fiandach is by far the very best you’ll find. A highly professional firm who really cares about their clients, rest assured that they will fight to get your charges dropped or win you a lesser charge.

In early 2019 I made a big mistake & drove home after drinking ~6 IPAs at a concert. I was pulled over & arrested after failing the sobriety tests I was given by a Monroe County Sheriff. After being arrested I was brought back to the station where I blew a .15 into a DataMaster, almost twice the legal limit, just short of an aggravated DWI.

After much research about who to call, I came across great reviews for Fiandach. I called the firm to ask some questions & got in touch with Sue, who was very caring & gave me all the information I needed to know. She organized a time for me to meet in person with Ed Fiandach for a consultation. After describing the details of my arrest & charges with Ed in person, I had a feeling of relief based off his professional responses & confidence in his ability to take my case to trial & get my charges reduced to a DWAI. This would be a huge win for me, I instantly knew I was in good hands.

I was fortunate enough to retain Ed himself as my representation & it was like an enormous weight had been lifted off my shoulders.

Upon my arraignment, I was concerned I would have to give up my license until I stood trial. Ed was prepared with paperwork to fight for me to get a hardship license, though he was confident we wouldn’t even need it. I couldn’t believe it when the judge allowed me to keep my license throughout the entire 8 month time frame leading up to my trial without the need for any hardship paperwork. I could tell the judge had a high level of respect for Ed Fiandach which in turn allowed me this privilege, again realizing I was in good hands.

Ed & his firm put together a strong litany of detailed documents making the prosecutor work hard to produce many points of evidence to comply for discovery. Honestly, if I were a prosecutor, I really wouldn’t want to be up against a defendant who is shielded by Fiandach & his brilliant team. These documents really made the prosecutor work hard to produce their supporting documentation, & I sensed just by looking at his body language & mannerisms that the prosecutor was very annoyed at the amount of work he would have to do for my case!

8 months later, my trial was held. I was especially nervous when I noticed there was an entire Criminal Justice class from a local college sitting in watching & taking notes. I didn’t know what to expect, I thought for sure after blowing a .15 I would definitely be nailed with a DWI, marking my squeaky clean record with a nasty criminal stain. I worried about my future job prospects, my car insurance, needing an interlock installed, a smorgasbord of fines, and everything else that goes along with getting a DWI sentence.

Ed felt right at home in the courtroom, his years of experience shows. He listened to every word the prosecutor said & spoke out several times to force him to move on to the next sentence, & give up on defaming my good character. Each time Ed gave the judge a detailed explanation for why the prosecutor should refrain from mischaracterizing the details. Ed did an outstanding job cross-examining the Sheriff in front of the judge, painting a picture for the court which showed me in a positive light.

I was so happy when the judge came to his decision to lower my DWI to a DWAI! Ed Fiandach is truly a magician in the courtroom. He got the outcome I so dearly wanted & now my record remains clear of any criminal convictions! I’ve signed up for the NYS IDP program so I’ll never even have to experience not being able to drive, I get a conditional, it’s all I need.

It was worth every cent. If you’re serious, I highly recommend this firm.

I live ic Washington state and needed to hire a lawyer in California to assist me in restoring my Gun right that were taken away due to a was erroneously labeled as a felony instead of a misdemeanor.

I hired Mr. Thabet to assist me in this effort.  Mr. Thabet and paralegal Anna Loya worked vigorously through roadblocks and hurdles and successfully resolved my case from 1974. They succeeded in my case reduced to a misdemeanor and expunged.

Even after I thought the case to be close they continued to find a way to have my gun rights returned to me.  They are instrumental in restoring my dignity and honor. This team is highly commendable and reliable.  Thank you.
M Morgan

reviews.text:
Today, I got my case expunged, and I owe it all to my lawyer, Levon.

Back in 2020, during the height of COVID, I made a big mistake. I was 25, struggling with lockdown depression, and ended up DUI. That morning in custody hit me hard, and after sobering up, I made one of the best decisions of my life—uBer to to Levon’s office. For the past four years, he’s been incredibly supportive, guiding me every step of the way. First, he managed to get the charge reduced to a wet reckless, and now, it’s officially expunged just after 4 years.

When I look back at my younger years, I realize how reckless I was. Now, I’ve grown. I have a wife, a family, and a clearer sense of what really matters. I’ve learned not to make foolish decisions anymore.

Thank you, Levon, for standing by me all these years. You’ve not only been my lawyer but a true friend. That said, Better Call Saul!

reviews.text: 3 months after hiring Nghi all 14 misdemeanors on my record were expunged! You’re probably thinking 14 misdemeanors??? Yes, that was my record for a long time after an 8 year battle with heavy drug addiction that left my criminal record battered with a troubled past. After cleaning up my life those charges still loomed over me, I was unable to get the job I wanted and it made me doubt myself knowing they were there even though I completely turned around my life.  So I finally decided to do something about it after almost 7 years of sobriety and tired of not having the career I want. Initially I attempted to do the expungement process myself but quickly realized all the forms and procedures were completely foreign to me and didn’t want to draw this out any further.  That’s when I looked up a Criminal lawyer and met Nghi who is so nice, friendly and Kind hearted person. He explained the process thoroughly and got everything done so quick!! My cases were a little complicated, I had 5 cases out of 4 different court house that made up all those misdemeanors. He was able to go to each one individually for me, I didn’t have to miss any work, or appear at any court dates. He even was able to get one case dismissed that still had unpaid probation fees that I wasn’t quite able to pay off before starting this process . He’s definitely a talented and amazing lawyer and I’m thankful to have him in my corner god forbid I ever have a brush with the law again.

reviews.text: Would recommend seeking other attorneys. The only time they were really attentive is the initial consultation when they are getting ready to ask for money as a retainer. After that my defense attorney was a lay down and was easily pushed around by the opposing counsel. He seemed to be well known, but certainly did not have enough clout to get good results for me. I was 42 years old at the time with a clean record , a veteran, and had NEVER been in any trouble before. I was charged with Felony Assault.  Not only did I end up with the felony, but from day he never got an inch from the other attorney and kept telling me how it was the best we could do. I believe many other attorneys could have had the charge reduced and I likely would have ended up with a misdemeanor.  At one point I had to call and email my attorney no less than 6 times over a 2 week period with no response. I had to complain to another attorney at the firm to get a response. My attorney continued to tell me what he would do, but NEVER followed through without repeated requests or follow up on my part. Very non-responsive and maybe they just take too many clients at once. On top of that, he knew I was a veteran and didn't even tell me I could have been eligible to be tried or have my case go through the veterans courts. I likely would not have even had a felony. I made the mistake that got me in trouble, no doubt about that, but the other mistake I made was trusting this firm to represent me. Your money would be better spent elsewhere. Also, used the family division of this firm through a divorce. Had to fire them and hire a different firm which made the attention I was getting from Jason at WMDT look like a joke. I got farther and more answers from MI Family Law Center in a few days than this firm got me in 2 months. Thank goodness I switched! I plan to have my felony expunged when I can. I will not use this firm for that unless they offer to do it free for doing such a poor job TWICE.

reviews.author: Robin Peters

reviews.text:
Had a difficult case that should have been nothing, not an arrest certainly. The problem is once you are  arrested you really aren't innocent until proven guilty. Once your arrested good luck on your own, even if you are "barely" guilty. The problem is once convicted you have the same record as someone who beat their spouse and caused bodily harm, for tossing a computer AWAY from anyone. (Yes, not good but a crime?)

Susanne was able to walk me through the process and defend me. Yes, I paid fines and classes, but these were minimal in comparison to what others have experienced.

Jump forward 2 years. Surprise, surprise, I have a warrant for the above charges. The person that was supposed to close my case at AP&P quit, and my case did not get closed complete as it should have been. I called Susanne and she immediately took my case to the courts for dismissal, which it was. The courts were putting me off until the end of the month. I have a background check requirement for a new job. They aren't going to hire someone with an open warrant.

Susanne continues to impress me, worth the money. (She is not the cheapest, just the best.) We are going to work to have these charges expunge in June. I know Susanne will get it done. She know the laws, and she understands the Utah criminal system and courts inside and out.

reviews.text:
I came to Conyers & Nix to have my record expunged upon a referral. Garrison & Jesse are awesome!!
The prosecutor denied my expungement, So we needed to go to court. I was pretty upset about this and expressed my frustration to Garrison with a few emails, he was so nice about me venting to him and told me that’s what they were there for. Today Jesse represented me in my court hearing and it went beautifully. He made me feel so at ease just before we went in the court room. He said I just know it would get expunged and I haven’t lost a case yet ! The prosecutor made a ok case but Jesse’s was much better!! So today the judge granted me an expungement of my record. I am so beyond thrilled and cannot thank Garrison and Jesse enough. If you’re looking for a lawyer, who is not only great but actually cares, then look no further.  Conyers and Nix  is where you want to go!! 😀
reviews.author: D D

reviews.text:
I had always been under the impression that criminal defense attorney's were of questionable character, that they helped unseemly types evade justice. But then I had an overzealous detective (from Holladay, UT) cite me for a criminal offense that I simply did not commit. I can't fully express how disappointing it was to discover first-hand that police aren't always interested in facts, fairness or justice. This "detective" wasn't keen on actually doing any detecting at all. He just made a judgement off the cuff and didn't care about the consequences for the people his sloppy decisions impacted. When I questioned him, he even acted like he was doing me a favor by only charging me with one offense. The arrogance and ineptitude was astounding. But either way, I suddenly found myself in need of a good criminal defense attorney.

A personal friend in the community recommended Jesse Nix, saying that he was a top-shelf attorney, kind, compassionate, and an all-around great person. I knew that he was exactly who I was looking for from our very first conversation. I had already been hounded by several criminal defense firms who proverbially chase the local paddy wagon for "criminal" clients, but Jesse was nothing like them. Jesse never asked me to hire him at all. In fact, for our first few conversations, he just wanted to listen, answer my questions, and give me some free advice on what options I could expect from the prosecutor's office moving forward. As a person who had never before been the target of police, much less received a criminal citation, Jesse was exactly the calm, insightful advocate I needed in an otherwise exceptionally stressful situation.

So I asked him to represent me and he did a phenomenal job. Throughout the process he never made me feel like I was wasting his time. He was patient with my questions, apprehensions and general twitchiness, and he always returned my calls and emails in a timely fashion. But most importantly, he relentlessly pursued the prosecutor assigned to the case and was able to get him to see that I simply didn't do what I was accused of and that the prosecution would lose if my case went to trial. He was convincing and my case was dismissed. Jesse then represented me in the subsequent civil case (which was also resolved favorably), and then he helped me navigate the expungement process so that my clean record remains as such.

Simply put, Jesse was absolutely outstanding. I'm sure that there are other quality criminal defense lawyers out there, but I wouldn't trust my legal life to anyone but Jesse Nix and his team. You cannot go wrong here; he is worth every cent. Hopefully I will never need to hire an attorney again, but if I do, I would hire Jesse Nix in heartbeat. He's the one you want on your side. He really is that good. Thank you, Jesse and Garrison!
reviews.author: Morti Merpeople

reviews.text: Jesse Nix and his colleague Garrison changed my life for the better.  I wanted a clean record that didn't follow me throughout my life and they made the process quick and easy.  They also kept me well informed along the way.  I am so grateful for Conyers & Nix for helping me make my future brighter.

A friend found Ryan Brown for me and I chose to hire him based on what I saw in reviews as a dedication to defense and willingness to stand up to bad police officers.
He and his staff, especially Tammy, were extremely helpful and responsive throughout the case. They kept me updated about various annoying delays and were straightforward, honest, and sympathetic when the legal system was constantly inconsiderate and inconveniencing me in ways that were outside their control.
Thanks to Ryan, I never had to go to court, will never have a conviction on my record, and the whole thing will be expunged. It was such a relief to have a lawyer and staff that I could trust enough that I could just let them handle things, knowing that I myself do not have any of the legal expertise I'd need to make heads or tails of what to do.

reviews.text: Hello, my name is Tyler and I have received more help than I could ask for from Malek's Law Firm over the last several months. If I had one thing to say about Linda Malek's Law Firm and team you will NOT be failed or disappointed. Linda and her team are workaholics and incredibly smart. They all pay very close attention to detail, and dig deep into laws and all facts. In March of 2022, Ohio passed Senate Bill 215 (Constitutional Carry) and around the same time I purchased a new handgun and holster for conceal carry. I did not have a CCW or a permit and I was under the assumption the bill takes immediate effect. Two days after the purchase, I was driving home while carrying my new firearm in my holster and was pulled over by a Cuyahoga Falls Police Officer for a head light that was out. As soon as the officer approached me, he said my headlight was completely out and immediately I informed him I had a firearm on me. He asked me why I had a firearm without a CCW or a permit. I told him because Constitutional Carry just passed. He informed me the bill doesn't go into effect until June 13th 2022, then laughs. When the second unit arrived on scene, the officer confiscates my firearm then they cuffed me and stuffed me into the cruiser. They booked me in Cuyahoga Falls jail and charged me with two felonies and a misdemeanor: Improper Handling Of A Firearm in a motor vehicle, Carrying Concealed Weapon, and Lighted Lights. I spent the night in the clink behind bars. Fortunately for me, I got in contact with Linda Malek's Law Firm shortly after and was in good hands. After the body cam and dash cam came back, turns out I never had a headlight out and the phony officer had made several bold lies. I was mistaken for Senate Bill 215 not taking effect immediately, but was wrongfully stopped without probable cause by Cuyahoga Falls Police. Linda Malek and her team worked extremely hard on this case. After six months and several court dates, Linda Malek and her team had beat this case and got both of my felonies completely dismissed. Also my firearm has been returned and I got everything immediately expunged. I can not thank the Malek Law Firm enough for all the hard work they've done for me which has set me up for a happy and successful future.

listings.name: Kenneth Padowitz, P.A.

reviews.text:
The day I met Ken Padowitz I handed him a preliminary report from a Audio Forensic Specialist that indicated abnormalities in the audio evidence the state had. I explained to Ken that I heard two different versions of this audio. I didn’t know the terminology then, but I told him exculpatory evidence had been removed.
Ken refused to speak to the forensic specialist, or allow him to do a final forensic report. Two years, and multiple requests both verbally and via email were ignored.
While constantly reminding me of the jeopardy I was in, and that a felony conviction with a one year probation was possible; he repeatedly tried to convince me that I was “mistaken” about the audio evidence.
I was forced to hire another attorney to get the audio analyzed and to hire a private investigator which Ken also refused to do.
I went ahead and hired the forensic expert that wrote the preliminary report I gave Ken. Ken disappeared. He didn’t attend a conference call to discuss the forensic report. Co council said he wasn’t returning calls. He didn’t return my calls or respond to my emails.
Fast forward, without Ken, a motion was filed and a judge threw out the recorded evidence after the same forensic expert that Ken ignored, demonstrated that 15 seconds of conversation were missing and portions of remaining conversations were now blank.
The judge then dismissed the felony charge. He then gave me a withheld of adjudication on the misdemeanor. No jail, no probation, and a sealed record.
If I did not hire additional attorneys to do Ken Padowitz job, there would have been no Forensic report, and I would have eventually been forced to accept a plea deal which would have resulted in a felony conviction.

reviews.text: Phil at Best and Brock did amazing! I just left an abusive relationship after 8 years. When I couldn't get an attourney to represent me to extend my tpo, and I lost the case.. It was all in retaliation to me finally able to leave the relationship. Because of this I spent 9 hours in silverdale, booked and fingerprinted and it was absolutely humiliating to say the least. I contacted Stevie, at the office next to Phills, she is getting ready to have a baby and referred me to Best and Brock. Things have not been good since I left the relationship,  my ex got the house and all the animals but 1. Due to me losing my job due to the charges. As soon as Phil got to the courthouse he assured me that everything was going to be OK! And let me tell you, I felt at ease with him. Not only did he talk to the DA multiple times on my behalf,  but he got the case completely dismissed and my charges will be expunged entirely! Phil is also going to write a letter to my employer, in order for me to hopefully get my job back. Phil completely exceeded every expectation I had. I cannot thank him enough! Thank you so much Phil and Best and Brock! U litterly made it to where I can finally breathe again! And now I can move on with my life, and start putting the pieces if mine and my daughters life back together. I could not be more grateful! Thank you for being such a blessing to me and my daughter! Pic of me and my daughter and my dog Beatrix. Because of Phil,  we can now build a brand new life together!

reviews.text: Was given a $6000.00 price tag but when I requested an itemized bill, I was denied. He would not continue to represent me unless every dime was paid up front. Would not work with us even after paying $2500.00 up front before the first docket. He claimed he tried to talk to the DA at the first docket but was not able to get it dismissed. I don't really believe he actually tried. I think he just wanted the other half of the money. Even after I couldn't come up with the other $3500.00, instead of working with me through the next court date he wanted me to postpone it in order to get the rest of the money, however, I said no and went to the court myself without representation and guess what after actually speaking with the DA myself, the case was dismissed and expunged. Saved $3500.00!!! Conclusion: when you go looking for an Attorney with a fancy office, fancy website, expect a fancy price and not that much bang for your buck.

After the court date, he continued to be supportive & promptly filed the paperwork to get my case dismissed & expunged. He supplied me with documents needed to help me in my employment search.

The staff of Houston & Alexander were also wonderful & of great assistance during this trying time. The paralegals were knowledgeable & quickly answered questions & submitted documents & files to the my case online portal.

I highly recommend the Houston Alexander law firm to anyone facing a legal situation. They will represent you with care, compassion & the utmost professionalism. They are definitely among the top legal firms in the Chattanooga, TN area.
