reviews.author: Janina LeVasseur

reviews.text:
I am writing this so that my experience with Tom can be known.  I was in a very difficult legal situation.  I was looking at my 4th D.U.I. This was a very difficult experience  for myself and loved one's .  I potentially was looking at serious jail time as well as my license possibly being revoked for life.  I am in my 40's, my life is very well put together, great job, place to live, great family and friends and my health. The possible consequences of my actions would have drastically changed my life and the lives around me.
My case was very difficult as this case involved myself being arrested for a  D.U.I in Rhode Island but my driver's license is from Florida. Not good to say the least. Again I was facing a 4th D.U.I. as I have 3 in the state of Florida.
Here is where Tom comes in.  Tom was recommended to me from a family/friend lawyer.  Tom came very highly regarded.  As a former state prosecutor he defiantly knows how the prosecutors act, think and his great reputation  is very obviously known in the courtroom .  Tom built a great client/lawyer relationship with me based on trust.  There were times in my case when I wasn't so sure if I had the best person representing myself, not only did I have the right person but I had the best lawyer. I had both, Tom the person and the lawyer.
My case as noted was extremely difficult, this wasn't the ordinary D.U.I, being it was my 4th and out of state. Tom worked within the legal system and was able to provide me with a hardship license to and from work.  I remember the D.A. in the courtroom denying me of this at first.  When Tom and I returned I in fact was granted this hardship license . I remember very well that I was told, "It's against my better judgement to grant you this, you should be thanking your lawyer for his competency ". I knew right then that I had the wisest person in the courtroom representing me.  Afterwards Tom met my family member outside of the courtroom , she was relieved with the ruling, he was very kind and genuine towards her.
Moving forward with Tom's expertise, effort and knowledge  I was able to drive to and from work.  I still had the D.U.I to contend with and if convicted , well off to jail I would go and life as I know it to be would have drastically  altered.
Tom once again found the police to have pulled me over without just cause. He and I were prepared to take this to court after my pretrial.  We had to wait for the state of Florida to collaborate with the state of Rhode Island. Tom was supportive, constantly working with me and my case during this time.  He always stayed in good communication, always did what he said he would do, and made me feel like there was a chance, there was reason to believe that my consequence's of my actions would be minimal .
In the end my D.U.I case was dropped by the state of Florida and Rhode Island.  I have community service and a alcohol class to attend . Meanwhile I am still able to drive to and from work.   Tom is also getting my charges expunged.  This is all very doable compared to the other very realistic possible set of circumstances that I could be in.
I write about my experience to share with other's . I write this because I want to thank Tom for all he accomplished for myself and family.  I think back to the times I had with all the unknowns in my life.  One thing I always knew was I had the right, best and trustworthy person by my side through this all. I obviously suggest that you don't make poor choices for yourself and don't have to deal with what I have.  If you are reading this you may have.  I strongly recommend , not suggest that you have Tom Thomasian as your lawyer. Tom, thank you!

Sergio
reviews.author: S

reviews.text: Tom is a very well connected and well respected lawyer, and I could not be happier with his legal services.  Before Tom I was sure I would end up in Jail, thanks to him not only did I not serve any Jail time, I only did a year in Drug Court and ended up graduating early with my record expunged and sealed. reviews.text: If you find yourself in a situation where you need help, Tom is the person you want on your side. My boyfriend and I found ourselves in a situation where we needed a lawyer and were not sure where to start as neither of us have ever been in trouble. I remembered seeing an ad for AVVO so I decided to look on there. We knew it would be a somewhat easy case, but I am a worry wart so I didnt want to just pick some Joe Schmo. I sorted the website to see who had the highest AVVO rating and the highest reviews and that is how I found Tom Thomasian. I read all of the reviews and everyone seemed to be very pleased with his services and I saw that he offered a free consultation so I figured it wouldnt hurt to just meet with him and see what he thought. I called Tom's office and I expected to just set up an appointment with a secretary, I left my name and number and about 5 minutes later Tom called me himself to set up the appointment. I told him our situation and he seemed confident that he would be able to help us out. A few days later we met him at his office and after meeting with him and going over what he could do for us, I knew he was the right person to hire. Now don't get me wrong, he isnt the cheapest attorney, but you get what you pay for. Do you really want to cut coupons for a lawyer? I dont, I would rather pay good money and feel confident walking into court with someone who I know has our back. Tom was always there to answer any questions we had, whether I called him or sent him a text message. We went to court three times, each time we were there for 10 minutes max. In the end our case was dismissed and we had it expunged. Hopefully I will never have to hire Tom again, but I will always keep his card in my wallet because if anyone ever needs help he is the person I will send them to. If you are looking for a lawyer and you are scared and have no idea what to expect (like I was) he is the best lawyer to have because he will talk you through each step of the process and make sure that you are comfortable with what is going on with your case.

reviews.text: I recently got a DUI. and I blew a .12, which isn't terrible considering it was my first. That's a stain that pretty much never can be expunged off your record. So I did my research and contacted around 8 different attorneys/legal firms in the San Diego County area. Some of them dealt specifically with DUI's others did a variety of legal practices. I found Peter Liss online through another attorney, who referred Mr. Liss to me. Boy did he come through for me! I didn't have to serve any extra jail time, I ended up with a DUI Misdemeanor which is essentially a slap on the wrist and only 3 months of OHS classes as rehabilitation. He also was diligent enough to get my fines reduced, not to mention he was very flexible as far as the cost. It wasn't an arm an a leg to retain him, and any time I needed him he was there (un-like the public defender I was assigned)

reviews.text: I got my first DUI and i was so scared. I searched for lawyers left and right and I stumbled upon DOD Law. Their reviews were fantastic and are affordable too. Dod assigned Luis to me and he is THE BEST. He made everything so easy. He set up my DMV hearing, he told me what I needed to do to help my case. My BAC level was a .212 and he negotiated and got it down to a .19. So instead of the 9 month program, I just had to do the 3 month and no Ignition Interlock Device, Probation is just 3 years and I can expunge it after 2. And in court we asked the judge to reduce the DUI fine. So now I only have to pay $200 instead of $2000. This is the best outcome ever. Luis is the best. I didn't worry about my case for 2 months it was so easy. If you’re looking for a knowledgeable, skilled, caring lawyer. Hire DOD Law.

Now I’m going after the city for wrongful incarceration because they had no proof to begin with and just suspicion.

Know your rights and stay motivated. My case took 2 years to expunge.

Military member past and present. This is the attorney to have when it comes to military diversion court.

If they take your DNA for registration remember to ask the court to remove it after your case is dismissed.

reviews.text:
Case dismissed! Music to my ears…
In 2014, I was arrested and charged for a crime that I did not commit.  I consulted with the senior partner of a law firm and signed a contract, thinking that this attorney would represent me.  Much to my chagrin, after submitting payment for services, they pulled a bait and switch on me and assigned two rookies with less than two years of experience to represent me.  I knew after the first court appearance that this was not going to work, since the prosecutor was very aggressive.  A colleague at work and another lawyer highly recommended Mr. McCoppin to me because of his background as a prosecutor and his expertise with difficult cases.  I was convicted in district court, but we appealed.  Mr. McCoppin worked with the new prosecutors and successfully got my case dismissed, without having to go to trial.  My case was difficult because we couldn’t prove that the witness was not being truthful.  I couldn’t be happier with the outcome.  We are now working on getting my record expunged.  I highly recommend this attorney.  He knows what he is doing.

I recently moved back home to Missouri from Colorado and reached out to Twibell Pierson Criminal Law about my case. reviews.text:
We had reached out to a couple attorneys to speak with and decide who we felt most comfortable with. David was the ONLY attorney who explained everything to us, was interested in our details and made us feel comfortable.

He believed in our son, was by him every step and in the end my son was able to breathe. No charges filed and his clean record in tact.

As far as rates, David was very reasonable compared to others in the area. He doesn’t just go off charges like everyone else. He gathers facts and possible outcomes to help determine his rates.

I hope we will never need his services again but if we do or if anyone we come across ever does, David would be the first call.

reviews.author: Andrea Ortiz

reviews.text:
I found myself in dire need of representation again, so I contacted Attorney David Tarr. I retained his services in the past and received exceptional results. I explained the circumstances surrounding my case and I felt like I didn’t give him much to work with and handed him a complicated case, but he accepted the challenge. Two months into the case I was diagnosed with cancer. Before court David and I mostly talked about my diagnosis, he was both personable and encouraging. Upon entering the courtroom, he talked with the officer but she would not waiver. He told me to concentrate on my treatment. Five months later the case against me was dismissed, and two months after that he won the DMV hearing. Now I focus strictly on my health. When David was deciding on a career path, I’m so grateful he found his calling and became a lawyer.

A couple years ago I had a run in with the law and afterwards I was solicited by mail from numerous lawyers. I conducted my own search and compiled a list of four lawyers. After speaking with three I felt hopeless and overwhelmed until I spoke with Attorney David Tarr. Speaking with him was calming and reassuring, he listened and wasn’t judgmental. After my consult he agreed to represent me in an out-of-town case, and I felt like he genuinely cared. Before the preliminary hearing I asked him to see what kind of plea deal they were offering. He came back and said let's go I’m requesting a trial. Two years later the charges were dismissed, and my record expunged, all for the original fee. Anyone looking to protect their interest needs to seek Attorney Tarr, he will get you the best outcome possible.

reviews.text: Attorney Jeff Grimes and his paralegal, Edina are absolutely amazing! They have done so much to help my teenage son. reviews.text: I am a returning client! My first experience with attorney Grimes was several years ago he was very professional, on time, knowledgeable and approachable. He managed to make a chaotic legal system and process very understandable for me. He strategized my case and it goes without saying everything turned out in my favor. This experience was the motivating force for me to come back in June of this year for expungement. Attorney Grimes’ staff has changed and expanded but I still received the same quality care, and commitment from them that I received from Attorney Grimes all those years ago. The office ladies are so polite, and professional. They communicate very well and at each step in your journey. Edina is super fast at responding to messages and questions through the client app. Amber is polite, friendly, and welcoming which goes a long way since she is the first person you meet. With this level of service, attention, and care  I will always use attorney Grines and associates!!!! Thank you again guys!
reviews.author: Destani Cole-Fields

reviews.text:
I am utterly amazed by Jeff Grimes, Lauren, Edina, and Sam Knolton. My experience with this firm is simply magical. There is  no other way to explain it.

I had never been in trouble with the law. Well, except for when I was caught racing on the highway when I was 16 (20 yrs ago). Community service in Alabama is awful, by the way.

I was terrified!! Mr. Knolton helped to assuage my fear! I spoke with him for my initial consultation with the firm. He explained everything so well.  He answered all of my questions so politely and truthfully. He explained the three things that could happen with my case. He was consulting with me on behalf of Jeff Grimes.

Jeff Grimes is the most epically awesome lawyer in the universe!! There isn't enough praise, in the world, that can be bestowed upon him!  October 4th, 2022, Jeff went in for my docket call to inform the judge that he was representing me. The very next day, Edina, Jeff's paralegal, called me.

I was sure it was just to inform me of my trial date. She called and said Ms. Fowler, I have some good news! Mr. Grimes was able to get your case dismissed and expunged from your record yesterday. He spoke with the DA regarding your  case and was able to convince her to drop the case!!

When Edina told me this I didn't even fully process what she had said. I asked her to repeat it. I was sure she had my case confused with someone else, but she didn't. I said, "Wait, what did you just say? You have got to be kidding me! Wait, are you serious!?! ". I was in a state of ecstatic shock!! I ugly cried when we got off the phone. I 'ugly cry' very rarely. I can't recall any time in my life where I had sobbed from sheer joy, happiness, and relief of this burden.

I requested to talk to Jeff in order to understand how he was able to get  my case dismissed pre-trial, on a DOCKET CALL! He called me within the hour and explained how it happened. I continue to be in utter amazement with the skills of my lawyer!

This was the first time I had ever spoken to Jeff on the phone. He was so personable, attentive, and polite. I was praising him during the entire phone call.  I still wear a huge smile on my face everytime I think about his unbelievable ability and competence as a lawyer.

Jeff's office is more than an hour away from my home. Even if his office were ten hours away, I will never choose anyone else to represent me. I am still stunned to this day. There aren't enough words in our language to explain how mesmerized I still am with Jeff and his team! Even if he retired, I would still bug him incessantly until he agreed to represent me if I were to get in trouble again.

Jeff Grimes and associates work so well together as a team! Jeff, Sam, Lauren, and Edina continue to impress me beyond comprehension. I am so extremely grateful to this team. Simply put, you would be a fool if you didn't choose Jeff to represent you!!

Jeff, Sam, Lauren, and Edina...THANK YOU SO MUCH for your competence and skills! I can't explain how grateful I am. Jeff has astonished me to the point that I view him as greater than a celebrity! Don't tell Jeff, but his prices are low! I would've paid him so much more if I had known how great he is!

JEFF, THANK YOU FROM THE BOTTOM OF MY HEART! I will never have a different lawyer from you, even when your office is more than an hour away from me.

Choose this amazing team to represent you, too! If you were to not choose this firm to represent you, then you are simply ignorant (sorry, not sorry). I know this review is long, but I could write so much more!! I am still shocked with Jeff's competence.

THANK YOU JEFF! THANK YOU EDINA! THANK YOU LAUREN! THANK YOU SAM!

Choose Jeff Grimes and associates, there's simply no one else like this team! THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!

-Andrea Fowler

I decided to hire Phil around 10 years ago ago on a case that was so impossible to attain, POST CONVICTION. Not only did he accept the case but what made it even more difficult was it was a conviction outside his county of ALAMEDA from 5 years back and to a county  unfamiliar to him which was 3 hours away. His ABSOLUTE REASONABLE FEES never changed upon learning additional detailsit and his approach was the sharpest I've never imagined. Not only did he get the case expunged but due to his EXORBITANT SKILLS,  he went further but getting the judge to VACATE the conviction due to CONSTITUTIONAL INFIRMITIES. And when you got more questions or need additional help 5 years after, He and Carla (His SECRETARY) continue to serve as though you were family.

To the readers of this review, I would say Go to Atty. Philip for all your legal help. He is not just a a dedicated, knowledgeable; sharp and professional counsel BUT a man WHO COULD BE ENTRUSTED. to fight for you
reviews.author: Dominic Lao

listings.name: Law Office of Ann Gottesman

reviews.text:
I'm incredibly glad and thankful that I chose Ann to be my lawyer. These are the reasons why she's a fantastic lawyer and why I highly recommend her:

1. I could tell she genuinely cares about her clients. She clearly presents everything you're legally facing, what you need to do on your end, and everything she plans to do on her end to win your case. When you need to contact her, she's a simple text or phone call away. When you have questions, she patiently and clearly explains everything to you.
2. She's professional and highly experienced. She's been there and done that. Consequently, she knows what she's doing and if your case is winnable, your chances of winning increase by hiring her as your lawyer.
3. She's very personable and nice. She has great relationships with many key contacts/prosecutors at the courthouses, meaning that it's highly probable that they're more willing to work with her to get your charges reduced/dismissed.
4. When she made one small mistake when communicating to me about my next monthly payment, she ended up reducing that month's fee by a few hundred dollars out of her professional courtesy. She didn't have to do that.
5. Finally, she got my charge reduced despite all the evidence against me. I plan to get the leftover charge on my record expunged once a year hits and hire her again to handle that.

All in all, I'm thankful to God for Ann - she did an absolutely incredible job getting my charge reduced. She was fantastic to work with. I highly recommend that you hire Ann Gottesman as your lawyer. You won't regret it!
reviews.author: Nathaniel Devorss

reviews.text:
I retained Ann Gottesman to represent and defend me after being charged with a misdemeanor. This charge would have had very serious implication on my professional career; it was going to adversely affect my abilities in pursuing any professional advancement and potential job offers.
Ann Gottesman was not only able to achieve a miraculous result, but also fought vigorously to have the charge commuted to a much lesser charge and worked even harder to have it expunged. Ann is one hell of attorney who is bold, competent and resourceful. I could not thank you enough and I am indebted to you for the rest of my life for the great work you have done for me. Thanks ANN.

listings.name: The Law Offices of Matthew Cargal

reviews.text:
When considering a defense attorney, you have to ask yourself... What is it exactly that you want, or better yet, what do you and your family NEED?
Do you want someone to be just professional and handle your case expertly, or do you NEED someone to work diligently day in and night out on your case, be thoroughly informative, and handle the entire weight of your legal situation both firmly and delicately?
Do you want someone to contact you once your case is done or do you NEED someone to be available 24/7, through emails, calls, and office visits, have any and every question answered? You will always be informed with all the inner workings of court, even when you dont have to be present.
Do you want someone that will give you a consultation and charge you and arm and a leg or NEED someone that has fair rates,  understands whatever economic hardship your going through, and creates flexible payment plans that cater to you? His consultations are free and put your mind at ease.
If you just want Joe Schmoe to take your money, and never hear back from, and most likely bend to the will of the court system than Mr. Cargal is not your guy. But, if you NEED someone in your corner to fight for and with you as I did during my overwhelming cases, than Matthew Cargal is most definitely the attorney you NEED to represent you!
Mr. Cargal helped me with two of my cases, one in 2013 and another slip up in 2014. With a 98% success rate, I figured it would be a no brainer to look him up. In both cases, he successfully tipped the scales in my favor and my family are forever grateful. It's been 5 years now no incidents, and he is currently working toward expunging both. Matt and I have created a trust, that I will forever hold dear, and he would do so with everyone that stumbles upon him. So dont hesitate to give Matt a call! Thank you again Matt, you've saved me time and time again, and it's safe to say, you've changed my life for the better!

reviews.text:
Mr. Jeff Voll was “GOD SENT” he floats on water his nickname should be Jesus

When I was young I found my self in a mess every so often, but after graduating from College in 2010 I decided to clean up my act as I was pursuing my career.  I needed to expunge my felony that I had in 2000. Also, In 2005 I was charged for a misdemeanor and again for the same incident in 2007. Unfortunately, I was 3 days out before my probation was over and the Judge denied my expungement for the 2007 case. Luckily I was able to get my felony expunged, but not reduced to a misdemeanor that was also denied by the Judge.

I was doing pretty well if I may say, after all that I still managed to graduate from a college, and start my career, but then again in 2015 I caught another case. This times a DUI misdemeanor. I was able to continue working with out anyone noticing my DUI  “Thank GOD”, but eventually in 2018 I changed jobs and had to inform my employer and still got hired, which was great but in 2020 my company I worked for shut down. Now I was in for a “rude awakening” how am I going to manage to find a job with a 2007 case that was denied expungement, 2015 DUI, and a ex convicted felon. Now I have a rap sheet, and thought to my self my future is finished.

Then there he was, as if he was “GOD SENT” I saw all the reviews for Mr. Jeff Voll online and decided to give the lawyer a chance, and boy did I make the right decision. Long story short, he did the impossible he managed to get my denied misdemeanor expunged, he expunged my dui, and the biggest hurdle of all he was able to file a motion, and get my denied reduction of my expunged felony reduced down to a misdemeanor.My expunged felony reduced that's  so Unrealllll!!!

I highly recommend Attorney Mr. Jeff Paul Voll, by far one of the best lawyers I ever came across, and I’ve had my fare share of attorneys in my life. I’m not exaggerating this guy is like JESUS, and floats on water. He worked on all my cases and was just knocking them out the park.

This lawyer I kid you not is bad A$$, If you find your self In a mess that you need to clean up Hire him, and he will get it done…He wiped my record clean, just think of that. Thank you Jeff you ROCK!!!!

reviews.text:
In 2007 I pleaded no contest to two counts Penal Code 487 (a) and one count Penal Code 459.
I served 2 years concurrently in state prison.

After I got out of prison I completely turned my life around. I went back to school and got Job training and performed volunteer work.

However, despite all of my positive contributions my past convictions continued to haunt me.
Even though I served my time, paid my debt and changed my life for the better; I continued to have legal issues with immigration. And trouble getting good jobs.

With regard to immigration, the consequences  of my two year conversation was extremely serious. Immigration charged me with an aggravated felony which carries a mandatory penalty of PERMANENT bar from living in the U.S.
I have been a permanent resident since I was 3y. this is my home!
I desperately needed a post conviction relief, to solve my immigration problem.

Before hiring Mr Escovar, I had attempted to get my charges reduced 3 prior times with 3 different attorneys without a shred of success. It was a total waste of time and money. I was running out of time!
I never gave up hope and I prayed for a miracle. My prayers were answered when I found Attorney Steve Escovar on yelp.

Mr. Escovar and his team did something that no other attorney EVER did before. He really listened to me and RESEARCHED my case.
He knows the laws and was able to use new laws to my advantage.
He worked hard to get me the post conviction relief that I needed.

My hope was to, at best, get my charges reduced,
Instead Mr. Escovar got ALL charges DISMISSED!

I will never forget when the Judge said: “You now have a clean record “.

I am still in amazement at what Mr. Escovar was able to do.
And his pricing is more then reasonable.

Thank you Mr Escovar and Ms Mateus for getting me out of what seemed like an impossible situation.

UPDATE: December 2021 DHS dismissed the case against me. And in June 2022 I became a Naturalized Citizen!

Edit: to include more details and update.

-Oscar M

reviews.text:
I found myself in a horrible situation with a ticket issued for stopping just past an intersection (for all of 3-4 seconds) at approximately 12:30 AM at night.  I had/have a clean record but was issued a biased ticket anyway.  There was a lot of legalese involved, where that ticket could have gone on my record as a conviction (5 years) and would have never been a simple court supervision deal.   To explain the ins and outs of it, I‘d be writing a lightweight memoir.  However, it was the totality of the situation that prompted me to look for an attorney.
After searching, I came across the 5 star rated law practice of Attorney Craig Boston.  I then called his contact number.  His message on his greeting says (paraphrasing), that his goal is/was to return your call within 24 hours of receipt of it …and he did! I’ll just put the brakes on for you and say “please stop” and look no further because he is an expert in “all things traffic”.  ….Experienced, talented and very knowledgeable of his craft…personable, no “airs”, no “fronts”…he just immediately puts you at ease and your fears to rest and makes you feel so comfortable in his direct approach to a resolution. I have never experienced such a warm exchange with an attorney in my life! (And believe me; I’ve sifted through “the deck” with my sons.) reviews.text:
Was arrested December 2017 in Georgia for possession of marijuana less than one ounce. Contacted Lynn Fleming. Explained to her the situation, as well as my concern in maintaining federal criminal clearances for work.

Lynn assured me that by pleading noli prosequi, the judge would assign community service instead of a sentence.  She also assured that no criminal history would appear on my record. I paid over $2000 for her representation. The charges were dismissed and I completed community service hours.

Months after the court date, I completed the federal background check.  Sure enough, the arrest record appeared on a federal background check.  I notified Lynn's office.  They said they were "shocked", would look into it, and would call me back.  They never did.

I contacted the courthouse and found them more helpful than Lynn.  The court clerk encouraged me to seek a "dismissal restriction" from the judge, which would clear my record even on the federal level.  After one simple email to the judge, he granted the dismissal restriction. Record cleared.

At the end of this ordeal, Lynn's services were misleading, pricey, and seemingly useless.
reviews.author: James Edward

reviews.text: I signed up for a 15 minute free consultation, and spoke with Javonte Middleton, the firm's expungement paralegal. I couldn't be more pleased with the experience! I had tried to look at the Georgia Code related to my situation myself over and over again, but I was totally confused about what I needed to do. That's because the laws, by their very nature, lacked a lot of the practical context involved in the day-to-day records management practices in Georgia's records systems. Javonte knew, off of the top of his head, impressively detailed information about record codes and practices and answered questions I had that were--to me--almost too complex to put into words. He walked me through a baffling GCIC background check document that I'd been having a lot of trouble understanding-- so many codes and fields and information.  He answered me clearly and completely, and was very open open letting me ask questions. I didn't feel rushed nor pressured at any point. I contacted the firm ready to pay them for what I thought I might need, but rather than let me do that, Javonte told me there was a much simpler way I could try to get what I needed and not have to pay either a lawyer or the court: advising me to try that before I paid anyone anything. He gave me such a large, clear amount of information and help in about 15 minutes that at the end of it, I really felt guilty that this had only been a free consultation. I wanted to pay them something, because Javonte basically solved the problem that's been keeping me awake at night for weeks. He said, that was okay, just tell people about my experience. So that's what I'm doing here. It's not only that Javonte related a lot of information to me in a clear and patient way. It's also that I felt very much that the firm would not charge me for unnecessary activities. If you need help with expungement/restriction/record sealing, I'd highly recommend calling DeVetter Law Firm!

reviews.text: I was arrested for a crime that was going to have a serious impact on my future & ability to achieve any success in life. The District Attorney had absolutely no interest in hearing the facts of the case & wanted to move forward with the case based on my prior convictions.  I obtained a public defender that despite his best efforts was unable to negotiate a plea bargain of any kind with the District Attorneys’ office. At one of my court appearances I was observing Steven represent one of his clients.  I was blown away with what I saw; I thought for sure this guy was going to jail. The mutual respect Steven shared with the D.A. was obvious & worked in his clients favor resulting in a reduced charge, no jail time & the minimum fine with a small amount of community service. I was facing serious jail time & had exhausted all options. I hired Steven & the results were immediate. The D.A. agreed to a smaller amount of jail time & although still expensive a much lesser fine. Steven said  “We can do better Chris”.  That sentence really sums up my experience with Steven, when Steven said “We” he meant it. The fight for my future became Stevens & he was determined to attain the best outcome possible. Steven treated me & everyone involved with the up most respect. As an 8 year veteran & a Non Commissioned Officer I know the meaning of respect, integrity & loyalty, Steven exemplifies all of these qualities. In the end I received NO jail time & a very, very small fine. I did have to plead guilty, however Steven followed through with my case & was able to have my probation terminated early along with my record being expunged. I now have a clean record & was able to attain an amazing job that had been lost now that my background check was clean.  I HAVE A FUTURE AGAIN. If you have a case in Orange County, especially Fullerton you NEED Steven Bloom as your attorney. I can thank you enough Steven thank you for making the impossible possible again.

I'm not really a review person. I barely do that, but I can't not post this one. I HAVE to share my experience. Last summer, I found myself in a not nice situation, and I got arrested for the first time. My world just collapsed. I was so disappointed in myself and scared of the consequences that could happen. I did research and made a few calls to law firms. They all sounded like this: leave your information, and we will contact you back. When I called the Michael Sahn office, it was different right away. The lady who answered the call was very nice and polite, and I could feel that they DO care about their clients. After a few questions, I was transferred to speak directly to Michael. He listened to my story, and without any superior promises, he agreed to work on my case. He said he couldn't guarantee anything but would do his best to achieve the best results. What he did. I never needed to come or contact the court on my own. Michael Sahn completely took care of everything. Yesterday, my charges were expunged. It's the best outcome that I didn't ever expect. listings.name: WOLF, STALLINGS & MAYO

reviews.text:
John and Andrew are excellent attorneys. I work with attorneys all the time in my career and never imagined I would need one...not a criminal one anyway. When I did end up in need, I knew of plenty attorneys that I didn't want representing me, but none that I actually did want.
In May of 2019 I was arrested due some false allegations against me. I heard about Mr. Wolf from a friend and contacted him immediately. After talking to John, and his partner Andrew, I decided they were the right choice for me and for my case. They immediately went to work for me. They met with me, spoke with me on the phone, texted, and responded to emails throughout the day and after hours, whenever I needed it. There was nothing I was in want for.
John, Andrew, and I decided to fight my case at the front end with the grand jury. This is no small feat, as grand juries usually only hear from the prosecutor. It took nearly a year and a half for the prosecutor to take my case to the grand jury. John and Andrew put together a "defense packet" and were able to get it pushed through so that the grand jury could review it. This is almost unheard of here in small town West Texas. When the case came back as officially a No-Bill, Mr. Wolf and Mr. Stallings both called me immediately to let me know.
I feel confident that we would have won this case in a trial, and for me, there was no other option. I was innocent and not about to plea in any other way. Both John and Andrew agreed and never tried to persuade me otherwise. John and Andrew's hard work spared us the trauma, time, humiliations and yes, money, that a trial would have brought.
They are still doing some work on expungement for me on my case, and there is absolutely nobody I would trust more.
If you need a good criminal attorney I would definitely look into hiring Wolf & Stallings.

My career depended upon a specific  outcome in my favor. My Clerk Friend without hesitation implored me to “ Call James, I love that man”. After my dealings with Mr. Rutherford, that makes two of us.
Let’s go to the Why?  I needed my case to not see the “ In God We Trust” above the judges head on my first court date. Seemed impossible! Well Attorney James Rutherford made the impossible possible.  Dismissed of all charges before my first court date.
The sensitive position I hold in the community requires that my perfect record stays as is.  Although it was not such a serious charge it must be expunged for me to create my dreams now and in the future. It was time sensitive and a very difficult task. James and Melissa were on it immediately and for this I am forever grateful.
Good attorneys are around yes. In fact I come from a family with 3 Attorneys sitting around the table. James Rutherford, however, is the best. his level of professionalism, timeliness and skills is second to none. This is not just my opinion it is my experience!

reviews.text:
I don't know where to start or how to explain my experience. Here goes, I was referred to Shawn and Matt through a friend. I spoke to Shawn first and he was understanding, empathetic, and motivated to take my case.

I worked mostly (about 99.99%) with Matt Martin and he was very professional and available to me at all times. I never had any doubt. I told him what I wanted to do and he took charge. I was up front and honest with Matt. I did everything he told me to do.

All I asked, is there would be no plea deals. I've always believed that innocent people don't plea.

I've never been in a situation like I was before. Nor had any of my family or friends. From my experiences, you have to be your own lawyer and investigator as well. At least be familiar with some of the legal documents. Also, gather whatever you can. Phone records, doorbell camera footage, text messages, anyone who was in the area, etc. Matt took everything I had, even my story in greater detail. I did not forgot a thing, every detail is key. That night sticks with me to this day. Matt will tell you, "we tell the truth". And that's all we had.

After nine months, going back and forth to court, the DDA (through Matt's work) agreed to drop charges that a lot of lawyers told me would never get dropped. Note: yes, I did reach out to a couple lawyers beforehand and most told me this case would never get dropped and either would get settled through a plea deal or going to trial. Matt was able to get my case dismissed and records sealed.

I went through hell, it was rough. I truly believe Matt was put in my life by God. He believed in me because I told him the truth and nothing but the truth. He's the guy I would go into battle with any day, at any time, for any reason.

I hired Matt to be my lawyer, in the end, he became my friend. Matt (and Shawn), if you ever need anything, I am there for you. Thank you for being there for me and allowing me to continue my life after that nightmare.

listings.name: Laina T. Chikhani, Attorney at Law

reviews.text:
I am immensely grateful for the incredible work Laina did on my case. What started as a phone call to report a serious road rage incident turned into a nightmare, with the Napa police filing multiple felony charges over a defensive statement I made during the call. This situation should have never escalated the way it did. The police took my frustration—expressed after dealing with constant harassment from officers—and attempted to give me two strikes for it.

The road rage incident itself was frightening: a person got out of their vehicle during a fit of road rage and began approaching me aggressively, forcing me to drive away for my safety. During the call to dispatch, I vented about how the police had been harassing me. Though I regret my choice of words, the context of provocation should have been obvious.

After months of zero progress with a public defender who didn’t seem to know what he was doing, my family hired Laina. She came into the case late—near the end of my 14 months—but her expertise turned things around. Laina genuinely sympathizes with people of color and is acutely aware of the unjust nature of the legal system. She effectively navigated the complexities of my case, addressing the incompetence that had been present in my defense. Laina saw through the prosecution's exaggerated narrative and successfully reduced my multiple felony charges to just one (Penal Code 71 for threatening an officer). After I completed my mandatory supervision, she helped me get that charge expunged, clearing my record, which is now just as it was before all this happened. This was my first and only charge, and Laina's work allowed me to remove this unfair burden.

Since my release, I have completed my degree in biology from San Francisco State University, maintained a healthy lifestyle with daily exercise and a plant-based diet, and continued to receive counseling and support from professionals who highly recommend me. While I believe the harassment I faced from Napa officers should have been more effectively addressed by the justice system, I’m grateful for the justice I received with Laina’s help. Her expertise gave me a second chance to live my life freely without the impediment of a felony.

If you're looking for a lawyer who is skilled, compassionate, and relentless in her pursuit of justice, I highly recommend Laina. She made a tremendous difference in my life, and I will always be grateful.
reviews.author: Matthew-Lee.

reviews.text: Laina is amazing! I wanted to get my record expunged for employment reasons. Kirby represented me on three different issues. The first being a 4 count felony case involving conspiracy. I was the co-defendant and the other defendant was facing a murder charge in a separate case that eventually was all intertwined into one case. The DA was tough, although I was completely unaware of the other defendants doings at that time and I was innocent of any wrongdoings, they charged me with different multiple serious felony counts of involvement because of my relationship with that defendant on a personal level. Kirby was able to get all the felony charges dismissed and reduced to a single misdemeanor disturbing the peace conviction with minimal plea terms, including only 1yr informal probation.

Once the informal probation was up, I then retained Kirby again to have that misdemeanor conviction expunged. Within weeks Kirby had that conviction and record expunged. Weeks later I retained Kirby again to expunge a DUI conviction I received over 10yrs ago. He first attempted to directly ask the DA, they refused to expunge that DUI. Those case expungements are on an individual case basis dismissed by a Judge. So once the DA refused Kirby immediately took my case to a judge and was able to get that DUI expungement for me as well.

I cannot say with words how grateful I am to Kirby and to his wife Kim. Not only did they fight for me every step of the way but they showed true compassion and made sure I was always aware of everything going on. He literally saved my life from charges that could have left me behind bars for a very long time. If you're looking for a criminal defense attorney in Riverside county, look no further. There is no one else you can entrust your case in more than Kirby.

reviews.text:
I recently had the privilege of working with Fresh Start Law Center, and I cannot express enough how impressed I am with the exceptional legal services they provided. This dedicated team not only secured the expungement of my felonies but also successfully obtained my Certificate of Rehabilitation, all at a discounted price that reflected their commitment to justice.

From the outset, Fresh Start Law Center demonstrated unparalleled professionalism and a genuine concern for me as their client. The legal process can be daunting, especially when dealing with felony expungements and rehabilitation certificates, but their team made every effort to ensure I felt supported and informed at every step.

What truly sets Fresh Start Law Center apart is their transparency and commitment to client satisfaction. Initially engaging their services for a Certificate of Rehabilitation, I appreciated their honesty in outlining the full cost associated with the process. Despite having paid the full price for the certificate, I was pleasantly surprised when they offered a discounted rate for the subsequent felony expungement.

Communication with Fresh Start Law Center was consistently impressive. The team was not only prompt in responding to my emails but also took the time to explain complex legal matters in a way that was easily understandable. This level of responsiveness and clarity significantly eased the stress of navigating the legal system.

The expungement process was handled with precision and efficiency. Fresh Start Law Center demonstrated a deep understanding of the legal intricacies involved, ensuring that all necessary documents were filed accurately and promptly. Their attention to detail and dedication to my case were evident throughout, resulting in the successful expungement of my felonies.

Obtaining a Certificate of Rehabilitation is no small feat, and Fresh Start Law Center navigated the complexities with finesse. Their expertise and commitment to justice were instrumental in securing this vital document, opening new doors for me as I move forward with my life.

In conclusion, I wholeheartedly recommend Fresh Start Law Center to anyone seeking legal representation for felony expungements or certificates of rehabilitation. Their friendly and polite demeanor, coupled with their unwavering dedication to their clients, make them a standout choice in the legal field. My experience with Fresh Start Law Center was nothing short of exceptional, and I am grateful for the fresh start they have provided me.
reviews.author: Buddy Ugwumba

reviews.text:
Fresh Start Law Firm has worked miracles for us from day one. David immediately found an error that was done by the court clerk. Who would have ever imagined the HUGE difference a lower case " a" vs an upper case "A" could make in the ability to secure an expungement. But he found it almost immediately and let us know what we needed to do to get the court to fix their error. Getting that taken care of took months but it was well worth the endless phone calls to the court. David encouraged us every step of the way.

reviews.text: This was my first time ever having to go through the expungement process, and I must say I am extremely pleased with the experience.  I saw alot of reviews on this company and alot of the complaints I saw were of people complaining of the documentation they had to provide. I feel you get what you put in and this company is here to help you as much as you let it. That being said, before I even called I had a copy of my disposition ready to go. I took the eligibility test, sent an email and got a response within hours. I personally talked to Mr. Huffman, got a list of things I needed to get ready and got to work.  Even living in Texas, the process went by smooth and quick.  Mr. Huffman required a few documents I already had ready prior and I was able to get letters of recommendation immediately.  Again, some of the complaints I saw were of people expecting this company to do ALL the work completely for them, which I thought was a bit absurd, especially living in these times we're in full of restrictions and delays. My start date was 03 DEC 2020 and I got my record Expunged with paper work in by 05 APR 2021. Not bad for being 3 states over and not once having to go back to California for any reason.  Mr. Huffman kept me updated with both emails and their tracking system online.  If you are going to go with this company, just remember, YOU are hiring them, and they are only as effective as you let them be. So have all your ducks in a row and be ready to help with some paperwork in order to receive the fastest response times available. Thank You Mr. Huffman for everything, I can now push forward with my career.

reviews.author: B. S.

reviews.text: About two years ago I was charged and arrested for a DUI. I had no idea how to go about finding an expert lawyer that handles DUI cases or how to fight the case. I kept seeing  and hearing Larrys name and was interested but also hesitant. I thought since he was so good that he would have to many cases and wouldnt have enough time to give mine his full attention. I called his office on a Friday afternoon right before his office closed and got a hold of him. We set an appointment and he came in on a Saturday morning just to hear my situation and see what the next steps were. When I saw that he came in on a Saturday and had his full attention I knew he was the one. He started on the paper work to allow me to keep my license  until  my court hearing immediately. He also recommend that I do 40 hours of community service, and attend  a DUI and defensive driving course which I did. Two years have passed since then and a court date was finally set. Not only was i available to speak to Larry whenever but he always replayed or picked up his phone as well as his team. When ever I wrote an email or made a call there was always a replay with in 5 minutes. They kept me up to date with any changes or no changes in my case the whole two years i was waiting. I also had an immigration problem because i wasn't able to renew my work permit because of the pending case, he stayed in contact with my immigration lawyers the entire time keeping them up to date and also making sure what he wanted to do wouldn't affect my immigration problem in a negative way. When you hire Larry you dont just hire him you get his great team as well. Finally after 2 years of waiting I had a court date set for December 2016 and I was a nervous wreck, but he came through and was able to get my case dismissed. The entire case was tossed out, no jail time, no probation, no nothing! I highly recommend Larry if you or anyone you know is looking for a lawyer. He gave me the best Christmas present I could receive by getting the case tossed out and keeping a clean record!!
reviews.author: jared ortega

listings.address: 5600 Roswell Rd Building H Ste 200, Sandy Springs, GA 30342

reviews.text: I contacted chad to represent me for a felony probation violation. I had an arrest warrant . Chad got me a court day without having to turn myself into custody . He also got my probation terminated and my fees lowered to half of the original and The original charges dropped. He is an outstanding attorney and is definitely the person you want to represent you if you want to win.  Thank you very much Chad now I can move forward with my life with a clean record . You are the man.
reviews.author: narcis jurovschi

reviews.text: Attorney Kindley is A man of his word! There is no run around, he is upfront and to the point. He is easy to talk to as well as explains everything so you understand what is to come. He got my A felony expunged of my record. He is More than fair on his fees! I recommend  Mr. Kindley 100%
